message_body:
*WEATHER FORECAST FOR 09 JANUARY 2026*
Issued at 05.30 a.m. on 09 January 2026
The deep depression in the Bay of Bengal to the southeast of Sri Lanka (At 04:00 a.m. on Jan 9th 2026 located about 200 km South east of Batticaloa) is very likely to intensify further and move northwestwards towards the coast of Sri Lanka between Pottuvil and Trincomalee in the evening today, the 9th January 2026.
Cloudy skies can be expected over most parts of the island.
Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern, North-central, Eastern, Uva, Central and North-western provinces.
Showers or thundershowers may occur at several places elsewhere during evening or night.
*Heavy falls above 100 mm are likely at some places in Northern, North-central provinces and in Matale, Trincomalee and Puttalam districts.* Fairly heavy falls about (50-75) mm are likely at some places in Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya and Batticaloa districts.
Very strong winds at times about (50-60) kmph and gusting up to 70 kmph can be expected at times over Eastern slopes of the central hills, Northern, North-central, North-western, Central, Uva, and Eastern provinces and in Gampaha and Colombo districts.
The general public is kindly requested to take adequate precautions to minimize damages caused by temporary localized strong winds and lightning during thundershowers.

message_body:
*Softlogic Stockbrokers*
*News Alert - 9th January 2026*

*Local*

*CB Governor gives upbeat assessment of economy with 2026 growth set at 5%*
Central Bank Governor, Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe kicked off the New Year with policies aimed at shifting gears from recovery in the economy to an enhanced growth while building resilience. At a function held at the Central Bank to unveil the customary policy agenda for 2026 and beyond, Dr. Weerasinghe was much more relaxed than ever before when he said he expected another year of 4 to 5 percent growth in 2026, backed by private and public spend, the latter of which is going to be relatively higher than before.
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business/CB-Governor-gives-upbeat-assessment-of-economy-with-2026-growth-set-at-5/215-329884 

*UK trade reforms open door to tariff-free Sri Lankan garment exports from January 1*
‚Ä¢ Reforms to the UK‚Äôs Developing Countries Trading Scheme are now in force with liberalised trade rules taking effect from 1 January 2026
‚Ä¢ Manufacturers can now source up to 100% of materials globally while maintaining zero UK tariffs
‚Ä¢ Garment exports from Sri Lanka to the UK expected to increase significantly under the new arrangements
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business/UK-trade-reforms-open-door-to-tariff-free-Sri-Lankan-garment-exports-fromJanuary-1/215-329883 

*Sri Lanka, EU ink ‚Ç¨8 mn grant to drive green growth in rubber sector*
Sri Lanka has secured a ‚Ç¨8 million grant from the European Union to accelerate its transition to green economic growth, with a targeted push to modernise and decarbonise segments of the country‚Äôs rubber value chain, the Finance Ministry said on Tuesday.
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business/Sri-Lanka-EU-ink-8-mn-grant-to-drive-green-growth-in-rubber-sector/215-329880 

*Link Natural-Sampath Bank strengthen agricultural development among rural communities*
In an effort to further strengthen its long-standing commitment to agricultural development and rural empowerment, Link Natural Products (Pvt.) Ltd has entered into a strategic partnership with Sampath Bank, under the bank‚Äôs flagship Sampath Saviya Agri-Entrepreneurship Development Programme. 
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business/Link-Natural-Sampath-Bank-strengthen-agricultural-development-among-rural-communities/215-329868

*Sri Lankan exports to Saudi Arabia record 19% increase in 2025*
Sri Lankan exports to Saudi Arabia recorded a 19% increase from January to September 2025, compared to the corresponding period in 2024. Ambassador of Sri Lanka to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Ameer Ajwad, stated that this double-digit growth represents an outstanding accomplishment in 2025, achieved through sustained and well-coordinated efforts undertaken by the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Riyadh in close collaboration with the Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Ministry, the Department of Commerce, the Sri Lanka Export Development Board, the Sri Lanka Tea Board, and other relevant institutions.
https://www.ft.lk/business/Sri-Lankan-exports-to-Saudi-Arabia-record-19-increase-in-2025/34-786706 

*Hayleys Agriculture partners Evonik to enhance poultry nutritional standards*
Agribusiness solutions provider Hayleys Agriculture Holdings Ltd. Has been appointed as the exclusive distributor for Evonik Industries AG‚Äôs globally recognised specialty nutrient portfolio, marking the first-ever introduction of these advanced animal nutrition solutions to the Sri Lankan poultry industry. Headquartered in Germany and active in over 110 countries, Evonik is among the world‚Äôs top five animal nutrition companies and one of the largest specialty chemicals manufacturers globally. Its animal nutrition division is renowned for evidence-based, science-led innovations that improve animal health, optimise feed use and enhance overall production efficiency. 
https://www.ft.lk/business/Hayleys-Agriculture-partners-Evonik-to-enhance-poultry-nutritional-standards/34-786704 

*Central Bank presses ahead with financial sector consolidation and resolution reforms*
Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe yesterday said its efforts to build a more resilient and stable financial sector will continue under the Master Plan for the consolidation of banks and finance companies, with a strong focus on long-term sustainability and systemic stability.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Central-Bank-presses-ahead-with-financial-sector-consolidation-and-resolution-reforms/44-786700 

*Gross official reserves rise to $ 6.8 b in 2025, highest since crisis: CBSL Chief*
Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe yesterday said Sri Lanka‚Äôs Gross Official Reserves (GOR) climbed to over $ 6.8 billion by end-2025, marking the highest reserve level registered since the country‚Äôs economic crisis, despite continued external pressures.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Gross-official-reserves-rise-to-6-8-b-in-2025-highest-since-crisis-CBSL-Chief/44-786699 

*Lanka Realty Investments leads Rs. 4 b control acquisition of Lee Hedges*
Lanka Realty Investments PLC (LRI) yesterday announced that it expects enhanced cash flow visibility and a materially strengthened balance sheet following the acquisition of a controlling stake in Lee Hedges PLC, marking a key milestone in the company‚Äôs ongoing turnaround strategy.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Lanka-Realty-Investments-leads-Rs-4-b-control-acquisition-of-Lee-Hedges/44-786698#.  

*India keen on execution-led economic engagement with Sri Lanka in 2026*
‚Ä¢ India‚Äôs top diplomat in Colombo says grid interconnection moves beyond technical stage to financial structuring; details progress in Trincomalee energy hub
‚Ä¢ Trade framework update on hold pending Sri Lanka‚Äôs decision on FTA upgrade or ETCA
‚Ä¢ Looks to deepen AI, digital and tech collaboration as part of next growth phase, with VC investments in startups
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/India-keen-on-execution-led-economic-engagement-with-Sri-Lanka-in-2026/44-786695   

*Global*

*US Senate votes to curb military action in Venezuela, Trump says oversight could last years*
The U.S. Senate voted on Thursday to advance a resolution that would bar President Donald Trump from taking further military action against Venezuela without congressional authorization, even as Trump said U.S. oversight of the troubled nation could last years.

message_body:
*NESTOR STOCK BROKERS*
*MORNING NEWS BRIEF 9th JANUARY 2026* 

_*Company, Industry & Market News*_

üéô *Lanka Realty Investments leads Rs. 4 b control acquisition of Lee Hedges*

Lanka Realty Investments PLC expects stronger cash flow visibility and a healthier balance sheet following its acquisition of a controlling stake in Lee Hedges PLC, marking a key step in its turnaround strategy. The move shifts LRI from land banking to a yield-focused model based on income-generating commercial properties, supported by strong liquidity and balance sheet optimisation. 

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Lanka-Realty-Investments-leads-Rs-4-b-control-acquisition-of-Lee-Hedges/44-786698

üéô *Wealth Trust Securities enjoys 167% rise on debut trading*

Wealth Trust Securities Ltd. made a strong debut on the Diri Savi Board of the Colombo Stock Exchange, with its share price rising 167.14% to close at Rs. 18.70 on the first day of trading. The IPO, held in December 2025, raised over Rs. 500 million and marked the company‚Äôs expansion from the debt market into the equity market.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Wealth-Trust-Securities-enjoys-167-rise-on-debut-trading/44-786694

üéô *Colombo Dockyard ceremonially launches Misje Kandy*

Colombo Dockyard PLC (CDPLC) launched the 10th and final vessel of its 5000 DWT Eco Bulk Carrier series, named Misje Kandy, built for Misje EcoBulk AS of Norway. The launch marked a major milestone for the shipyard and held national significance with the vessel named after Kandy, Sri Lanka‚Äôs ancient capital. The ceremonial launching followed traditional Sri Lankan customs, symbolically breaking a pot of milk over the bow and floating the ship in the dock.

https://www.dailymirror.lk/print/business/Colombo-Dockyard-ceremonially-launches-Misje-Kandy/215-329874

_*Economic and Government Updates*_

üéô *Central Bank presses ahead with financial sector consolidation and resolution reforms*

CBSL Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe said the Central Bank will continue strengthening Sri Lanka‚Äôs financial sector through the consolidation of banks and finance companies, focusing on long-term stability and sustainability. Enhanced monitoring of finance companies has already begun to improve risk management and operational efficiency in the non-bank sector. Consolidation is expected to create stronger institutions capable of supporting large investments, technology adoption, and financial inclusion.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Central-Bank-presses-ahead-with-financial-sector-consolidation-and-resolution-reforms/44-786700

üéô *Sri Lankan exports to Saudi Arabia record 19% increase in 2025*

Sri Lankan exports to Saudi Arabia grew by 19% from January to September 2025, while total bilateral trade increased by 9%, showing a strong improvement in economic ties. This growth was achieved through coordinated efforts by the Sri Lankan Embassy in Riyadh and key government institutions to promote Sri Lankan products. Saudi Arabia remains an important market for exports such as tea, food items, agricultural products, and construction materials, with new products like Ceylon Biscuits Ltd.

https://www.ft.lk/business/Sri-Lankan-exports-to-Saudi-Arabia-record-19-increase-in-2025/34-786706

üéô *Sri Lankan garment exports gain tariff-free access to UK from 1 January*

Sri Lankan garment manufacturers now have greater access to the UK market under liberalised trade rules, allowing them to source up to 100% of inputs globally while retaining tariff-free access. The previous requirement for two major manufacturing processes to occur in Sri Lanka has been removed, simplifying production and improving competitiveness. An Asia Regional Cumulation Group of 18 countries also allows Sri Lankan exporters in other sectors to source materials regionally while keeping preferential tariff

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Sri-Lankan-garment-exports-gain-tariff-free-access-to-UK-from-1-January/44-786696

_*Global News*_

üéô *Asia markets trade mixed following China inflation data; Uniqlo owner shares jump 7%*
https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/09/asia-pacific-markets-china-cpi-hang-seng-index-kospi-nikkei-225.html

message_body:
Lee Hedges PLC has disclosed that Lanka Realty Investments PLC has acquired a majority shareholding in the company following a transaction executed on 8th January 2026.

The disclosure indicates that 13,057,595 ordinary shares were acquired at a price of LKR 216.00 per share, representing 51% of the company‚Äôs issued ordinary shares, based on a total issued share capital of 25,602,730 shares.

The company has further confirmed that Lanka Realty Investments PLC did not hold any shares prior to this transaction, and the disclosure has been made subsequent to the completion of the acquisition.

This disclosure has been made in compliance with Section 36 of the Take-Overs and Mergers Code of Sri Lanka (1995), as amended, following the crossing of the applicable shareholding threshold.

Official announcement: https://bit.ly/4pA8zjT

message_body:
LOLC SECURITIES NEWS ROUNDUP -8-Jan-26

*Tea prices close December higher but 2025 underperforms year-on-year*
The national tea sale average rose to Rs.1,201.58 per kilogramme in December, up Rs.3.19, from November‚Äôs Rs.1,198.39, according to Forbes & Walker Research. In dollar terms, however, the average slipped marginally to US $ 3.89, from US $ 3.91 month-on-month.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/225xverj

*Abnormal trades in new listing spark market halt at Colombo bourse*
The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) halted trading minutes after the market opened yesterday, cancelling all trades executed during the session. The halt took place after detecting unusually high-priced transactions in the newly listed WealthTrust Securities that raised concerns of systemic risk spreading across the broader market, the exchange said.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/4srkphfr

*Rupee falls to Rs. 310 against USD for first time since Feb. 2024*
The Sri Lankan rupee continued its depreciating trend against the US dollar yesterday, with the currency weakening to the Rs. 310 level against the greenback for the first time since February 2024, based on the indicative spot rate published by the Central Bank of  Sri Lanka (CBSL).
Source: https://tinyurl.com/y8pw2vf4

*President pushes to bring informal sector into fold*
President Anura Kumara Dissanayake yesterday instructed officials to encourage small and medium businesses (SMEs) to register their enterprises while accelerating access to a 3% interest credit scheme for Ditwah-hit businesses.
Source:  https://tinyurl.com/ad83crca

*Sri Lanka signs ‚Ç¨ 188 m debt restructuring deal with Germany*
The Finance Ministry yesterday said it has signed a bilateral agreement with the Federal Republic of Germany to restructure external debt amounting to ‚Ç¨ 188 million, marking a further milestone in Sri Lanka‚Äôs ongoing debt restructuring process.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/46ufwpwc

*Sri Lanka, EU sign ‚Ç¨ 8 m grant to drive green growth in rubber sector*
The Government has signed a grant agreement with the European Union (EU) to launch a new initiative under the ‚ÄúAgriGreen Initiative ‚Äì Green Economic Growth through Sustainable Agriculture Practices,‚Äù aimed at promoting environmentally responsible agriculture and strengthening food security.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/4p8h4t5y

*SEC, CSE seek faster, cleaner listings through closer advisor collaboration*
Sri Lanka‚Äôs Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) have stepped up efforts to expedite new listings while tightening the accountability standards for the corporate finance advisors, as the regulators seek to strengthen investor confidence and market integrity.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/2n3m7tmx

*Global News*

*US seizes Russian-flagged tanker, another tied to Venezuela as Trump widens oil push*
The U.S. seized two Venezuela-linked oil tankers in the Atlantic Ocean on Wednesday, one sailing under Russia's flag, as part of President Donald Trump's aggressive push to dictate oil flows in the Americas and force Venezuela's socialist government to become an ally.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/4eux7pwe

*Japan condemns China's dual-use export ban as rare earth curbs loom*
Japan called China's ban on dual-use exports for its military "absolutely unacceptable" on Wednesday, amid a looming threat of broader curbs on vital rare earths in an escalating dispute between Asia's top two economies.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/9be7avdn

cleaned_text: section 4 cse trading rules

message_body:
OPEN AUCTION
The opening price is the price level at which the most number of shares/units of a security could
be executed. All trades will be executed at the same price ‚Äì the opening price.
At open-auction the system executes as many trades as possible at the calculated opening price.
Bids and asks do not have to balance in quantity for a successful open-auction to occur. Orders
at the opening price may remain partially filled or unexecuted due to an imbalance in the bids
and asks.
If the security does not trade during open-auction the price of the first trade after auction will be
its opening price.
4.1 Opening algorithm
Step 1 Volume maximization - The system will consider each price point at which there are
orders in the order book and calculate the number of securities that would be
executed if the auction took place at each price point. The open auction price will
be the price at which the largest number of securities can be executed.
Step 2 Minimization of order imbalance - If the volume is maximized at multiple price points,
then the open auction price will be the price at which the order imbalance is
minimized. Order imbalance is the difference between the total (cumulative) Bids
and Asks which can be executed at that price point.
Step 3 If the volume is maximized and the imbalance is minimized at multiple price
points and;
A. if the imbalance is on the buy side of all price points, the highest price is taken
as the open auction price.
B. if the imbalance is on the sell side of all price points, the lowest price is taken
as the open auction price.
Trading Rules
15 | P a g e
Confidential
C. if there are imbalances in both the buy and sell sides relating to the price
points, either the highest price with a buy imbalance or the lowest price with
a sell imbalance, which is nearer to the closing price (or the reference price in
the absence of the closing price) of the security is taken as the open auction
price.
D. if both price points referred in ‚ÄúC‚Äù are equally near to the previous closing
price (or the reference price) of the security, then the higher price point is
taken as the open auction price.
Step 4 Match all possible orders using price and time priority at the opening. Match from
the side of the market with the least orders against the side with the most, filling
all those above and below the price.
Step 5 Orders at the equilibrium price are satisfied according to the time priority.
Step 6 All unmatched orders will be stored in the order book when the market opens. These
orders will be stored in price/time priority order with orders of equal price given
time priority.
An example of the Open Auction is given in Annexure 2

message_body:
My understanding is that the 'market' order execution algorithm works differently in pre-open IPOs than in normal market conditions

In the case of the latter, the sellers' orders would be matched starting from the lowest order first, at the prices quoted by seller

This did not happen in the case of WLTH today, which suggests a different, possibly flawed, methodology
author: 190155465957631@lid

‚Ä¢ BYD registrations increase to 842 (vs. 264 in November). ATTO rebound driven by ATTO-1 and ATTO-2, marking a shift away from the previously ATTO-3 dominated mix.

message_body:
The SLTDA had been depending on spending estimates drawn from a 2018 survey, but its updated assessment from August 2025 has prompted a sharp reduction in its per-day spending figure from $ 171 to $ 148.

‚ÄúThis will be a leakage survey to determine how many dollars out of the $ 148 remain in Sri Lanka,‚Äù Hewawasam said, stressing the importance of understanding the real economic benefits generated by tourism.

In tourism economics, leakage refers to the portion of visitor spending that flows out of the host country rather than circulating locally. This typically occurs through imports of food and beverages, repatriation of profits by foreign-owned hotels and airlines, payments to overseas marketing agents, and remittances by foreign workers. While some level of leakage is unavoidable in an open economy, excessive leakage significantly reduces tourism‚Äôs contribution to local incomes, employment and development.

message_body:
*NESTOR STOCK BROKERS*
*MORNING NEWS BRIEF 7th JANUARY 2026*
 
_*Company, Industry & Market News*_

üéô *Durdens Hospital proposes four-for-one share split*

Ceylon Hospitals PLC (Durdans) has proposed a 1-for-4 share subdivision for both voting and non-voting shares, subject to regulatory and shareholder approvals, with no change to stated capital. Following the split, voting shares will increase to 127.05 million and non-voting shares to 40.54 million, while stated capital remains at Rs. 1.78 billion.

https://www.ft.lk/business/Durdens-Hospital-proposes-four-for-one-share-split/34-786605

üéô *Wealth Trust Securities starts trading on CSE Diri Savi Board today*

Wealth Trust Securities Ltd. (WTS) will commence trading today on the CSE‚Äôs Diri Savi Board under the ticker WLTH-N-0000, following a highly successful IPO. The IPO raised Rs. 500.8 million through the issue of 71.5 million shares at Rs. 7 each and was oversubscribed 14.9 times, attracting strong investor demand.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Wealth-Trust-Securities-starts-trading-on-CSE-Diri-Savi-Board-today/44-786622

üéô *Ching San Lim joins Chevron Lubricants Lanka Board*

Chevron Lubricants Lanka PLC has appointed Ching San Lim as a Non-Executive Director, bringing extensive global finance and board-level experience within Chevron. He currently heads Global Finance for Chevron‚Äôs Base Oil and Finished Lubricants business and has held senior regional and international roles across Asia, the US, and Korea.

https://www.ft.lk/business/Ching-San-Lim-joins-Chevron-Lubricants-Lanka-Board/34-786558

_*Economic and Government Updates*_

üéô *Singapore Airlines increases flights to Colombo*

Singapore Airlines has launched three new daytime flights between Colombo and Singapore from 6 January 2026, operating on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Sundays, increasing total weekly services to ten flights. The routes will be served by Airbus A350 and Boeing 787-10 Dreamliner aircraft, enhancing comfort and efficiency. 

https://www.themorning.lk/articles/U5mNltWfVd4yHWtuIalc

üéô *NEM Construction gets Rs. 699.56 m Mahaiyawa railway line project*

The Cabinet has approved awarding the Rs. 699.58 million (excluding tax) contract to NEM Construction Ltd. to build an underground concrete way beneath the Mahaiyawa railway line on the Kandy‚ÄìJaffna (A-009) road. The contract was awarded following a national competitive procurement process, with NEM Construction selected as the lowest and most responsive bidder.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/NEM-Construction-gets-Rs-699-56-m-Mahaiyawa-railway-line-project/44-786623

üéô *Tourism arrivals grow by 15% to 2.36 m record high in 2025*

Sri Lanka‚Äôs tourism arrivals rose 15% YoY to a record 2.36 million in 2025, with December marking the strongest-ever month at 258,928 arrivals. India remained the top source market contributing 27% of arrivals, while tourism earnings exceeded $3.2 billion despite lower per-day spending. 

https://www.ft.lk/top-story/Tourism-arrivals-grow-by-15-to-2-36-m-record-high-in-2025/26-786582

_*Global News*_

üéô *Asian defense stocks pull back amid mixed regional trading, geopolitical uncertainty*
https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/07/asia-pacific-markets-nikkei-225-kospi-csi-300-hang-seng-index-australia.html
-NESTOR RESEARCH-

*Softlogic Stockbrokers*
*News Alert ‚Äì 7th January 2026*

*Local*

*Tourism arrivals grow by 15% to 2.36 m record high in 2025*
‚Ä¢	Dec. delivers strongest monthly performance in history with 258,928 arrivals, up 4.2% YoY
‚Ä¢	India remains top source market with 531,511 visitors or 27% of total arrivals, followed by UK and Russia
‚Ä¢	Tourism Minister Vijitha Herath says earnings surpass $ 3.2 b despite lower per-day spending estimates
‚Ä¢	Targets minimum 3 m arrivals in 2026
‚Ä¢	Assures roll-out of visa-free scheme in 1Q and unified national brand this year
https://www.ft.lk/top-story/Tourism-arrivals-grow-by-15-to-2-36-m-record-high-in-2025/26-786582

*SLTDA to unveil tourism revenue leakage survey end of this month*
Sri Lanka will launch a comprehensive tourism leakage survey later this month to determine how much of the revised average daily tourist spending of $148 is retained within the local economy, aiming to better measure tourism‚Äôs true economic contribution and guide policies to maximise domestic value retention.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/SLTDA-to-unveil-tourism-revenue-leakage-survey-end-of-this-month/44-786626

*Wealth Trust Securities starts trading on CSE Diri Savi Board today*
Shares of Wealth Trust Securities Ltd. will begin trading today on the Colombo Stock Exchange‚Äôs Diri Savi Board following a heavily oversubscribed Rs. 500.8 million IPO, marking a key milestone in strengthening its capital base and expanding its role in Sri Lanka‚Äôs government securities market.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Wealth-Trust-Securities-starts-trading-on-CSE-Diri-Savi-Board-today/44-786622

*EDB calls for applications for IPD sourcing mission to access EU market*
The Export Development Board has called for applications for this month‚Äôs sourcing mission by Germany‚Äôs Import Promotion Desk, aimed at helping Sri Lankan SMEs access European markets by establishing sustainable trade partnerships across sectors such as agri-products, natural ingredients, digital services and sustainable tourism.
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-news/EDB-calls-for-applications-for-IPD-sourcing-mission-to-access-EU-market/273-329668

*SL to present progress on trade negotiations*
The Sri Lankan Government will present an update to Parliament in two weeks on ongoing trade negotiations with the United States, as lawmakers stress the urgency of securing favourable terms by March 2026 amid heightened US tariff actions and Sri Lanka‚Äôs weakened negotiating position following Cyclone Ditwah.
https://www.themorning.lk/articles/ne2tJ4KrOUcPlHeU5gj1

*Bill on microfinance issues goes to P‚Äôment*
An NPP MP announced the submission of a new bill to Parliament to address chronic microfinance debt issues linked to reported suicides, as authorities also probe a major investment scam using the Colombo Stock Exchange‚Äôs name that has caused significant investor losses.
https://www.themorning.lk/articles/Eg34ksw7TNs0XaY3OfMx

*President pushes for efficient budget allocation*
President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said the 2026 Budget has been framed within tight fiscal limits by prioritising national needs, urging public officials to ensure efficient and timely use of allocated funds‚Äîespecially capital expenditure‚Äîto avoid past failures in translating budgets into tangible development outcomes.
https://www.themorning.lk/articles/5GNDu405HpqIEPhQYmxr

*Singapore Airlines increases flights to Colombo*
Singapore Airlines will launch three weekly daytime flights between Colombo and Singapore from 6 January 2026, raising total services to ten per week and enhancing connectivity, scheduling flexibility, and access to its global network via the Singapore hub.
https://www.themorning.lk/articles/U5mNltWfVd4yHWtuIalc

*FACETS Sri Lanka 2026 draws strong int‚Äôl participation*
FACETS Sri Lanka 2026 concluded successfully in Colombo, drawing strong international participation and buyer engagement, and reinforcing renewed global confidence in Sri Lanka‚Äôs gem and jewellery industry ahead of the 2027 edition.
https://dailynews.lk/2026/01/07/business/928804/facets-sri-lanka-2026-draws-strong-intl-participation/

*Global*

*Chip stocks jump on AI optimism; Dow ends at record high*
‚Ä¢	Cooling systems firms fall after Nvidia CEO's comments
‚Ä¢	Memory and storage chipmakers hit record highs
‚Ä¢	Stock valuations pricey ahead of earnings season
‚Ä¢	S&P 500 +0.62%, Nasdaq +0.65%, Dow +0.99%
https://www.reuters.com/business/wall-street-futures-muted-investors-pause-after-rally-2026-01-06/

*Venezuelan oil would boost US refiners, hurt Canadian producers*
‚Ä¢	US Gulf Coast refiners set to benefit if Venezuelan sanctions end
‚Ä¢	Canadian crude will lose pricing power if Venezuelan oil flows freely
‚Ä¢	Chinese independent refineries will seek alternatives if Venezuelan crude is redirected
https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/venezuelan-oil-would-boost-us-refiners-hurt-canadian-producers-2026-01-06/

*WTI crude extends decline after Trump says Venezuela will send oil to US*
U.S. crude prices fell more than 1% after President Donald Trump said Venezuela would supply 30‚Äì50 million barrels of sanctioned oil to the United States, raising expectations of increased supply and pressuring prices.
https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/wti-crude-extends-decline-after-trump-says-venezuela-will-send-oil-us-2026-01-07/

message_body:
IMPACT OF CYCLONE DITWAH ON SRI LANKA‚ÄôS POULTRY SECTOR AND LISTED POULTRY COMPANIES
  
1. Direct supply shock to poultry production
Cyclone Ditwah caused material losses to Sri Lanka‚Äôs poultry sector, with government and industry estimates indicating the death of around 500,000 layer birds and approximately 1.4 million broiler chickens due to flooding and farm level damage.
As a result, national egg output declined by around 30 percent, triggering an immediate supply deficit and reversing the prolonged oversupply cycle that had previously depressed pricing.
Broiler operations were also affected, both through direct bird losses and infrastructure damage, tightening chicken meat supply in the market.

2. Market response and pricing dynamics

The sudden contraction in supply resulted in a sharp improvement in pricing across the poultry value chain.
Egg prices increased materially as output fell. Layer day old chick prices rebounded strongly from cyclical lows as farmers rushed to restock. Broiler DOC prices also strengthened, supported by rising chicken meat prices and improved grower economics.

( Source: https://economynext.com/sri-lanka-egg-output-down-30-pct-after-ditwah-kills-500000-layers-industry-252380 )

Chicken meat prices have moved higher as broiler supply tightened, improving margins for integrated poultry producers and contract growers.
This pricing reset has materially improved sector level profitability, particularly for upstream DOC producers, feed suppliers, and vertically integrated players.

3. Government funding support and restocking acceleration

The Government has introduced a compensation and recovery programme for cyclone affected poultry farmers.
(Source: https://economynext.com/sri-lanka-to-give-up-to-million-rupees-for-cyclone-hit-chicken-farmers-254019 )

Under this scheme
Farmers receive LKR 500 per killed layer bird
Farmers receive LKR 250 per killed broiler bird
Total compensation is capped at LKR 1 million per farmer

This funding directly accelerates restocking. The first purchases by farmers are DOCs and poultry feed, ensuring immediate demand visibility for upstream suppliers and reducing balance sheet stress at the farm level.

4. TAFL as the primary DOC beneficiary

Three Acre Farms PLC is the largest day old chick manufacturer in Sri Lanka and is one of the largest direct beneficiaries of the post cyclone recovery.

Rising restocking demand has driven
Higher DOC volumes
Improved DOC pricing
Better hatchery utilisation
Stronger margins and cash generation

Given its scale and nationwide distribution, TAFL captures a disproportionate share of incremental DOC demand during the restocking phase.

5. GRAN benefits across multiple verticals

Beyond TAFL, GRAN benefits across the entire poultry value chain, making it another strong listed plays on the sector recovery.

Chicken meat pricing and volume recovery
GRAN has meaningful exposure to broiler production and processed chicken meat. The tightening of broiler supply post cyclone has resulted in higher chicken meat prices, improving revenue per bird.

As restocking accelerates under the Government support programme, broiler volumes are expected to recover sequentially, supporting higher throughput and better operating leverage.

This combination of price improvement and volume recovery supports margin expansion at the poultry processing and farming level.

Feed business as a structural earnings driver
GRAN is the largest animal feed manufacturer in Sri Lanka, supplying poultry feed to both integrated operations and independent farmers.

The cyclone and subsequent restocking cycle are structurally positive for the feed business.

Each layer or broiler restocked increases feed consumption over multiple months. As farms restart operations using compensation funds, feed demand rises immediately and remains sticky through the production cycle.

Higher feed volumes improve
Capacity utilisation at feed mills
Operating leverage and margin stability
Cash flow visibility

Given GRAN‚Äôs dominant market share, a large portion of incremental feed demand flows directly to the group.

6. Earnings outlook and cycle positioning

Based on current dynamics

Margin expansion and volume recovery should be visible from 4Q2025
1Q2026 is likely to be the strongest quarter, driven by peak restocking, firm DOC pricing, rising feed volumes, and elevated chicken meat prices
Beyond this period, some normalisation is expected, but at structurally higher utilisation levels compared with the pre cyclone oversupply phase

The recovery is supply driven and policy supported, rather than demand led.

7. Key takeaway for investors

Cyclone Ditwah has acted as a reset mechanism for Sri Lanka‚Äôs poultry sector.

TAFL emerges as the clearest beneficiary through DOC pricing and volume recovery, while GRAN benefits on three fronts
DOC earnings through TAFL
Higher chicken meat prices and volumes
Rising feed demand as the largest feed player in the country

This creates a multi layered earnings recovery supported by improved pricing power, higher utilisation, and strong cash generation.

message_body:
*CEB tender awards in 2H2025 amp up cables sector orderbooks*
* Since our last publication on the Cables sector, ‚ÄúCables sector outlook: Wired to win‚Äù (11th Sept 2025), share prices across the sector have rerated materially with KCAB, ACL and SIRA rising by 60%, 59%, and 29%, respectively. 
* In our publication, we highlighted a significant pickup in CEB tendering activity compared to previous years, supporting a more constructive earnings outlook for cable manufacturers. This was evidenced by SIRA‚Äôs improved share of CEB tenders alongside a higher aggregate tender value, which translated into strong earnings delivery, with EPS growth of 133% YoY and 121% QoQ. 
* More recent tender awards point to a further acceleration in CEB activity, with the balance now shifting in favour of ACL. As such, ACL is increasingly well positioned to emerge as the primary beneficiary of CEB-related business in the coming quarters.

_CAL Research_
author: 140303881220173@lid
cleaned_text: ceb tender awards in 2h2025 amp up cables sector orderbooks since our last publication on the cables sector, cables sector outlook: wired to win 11th sept 2025 , share prices across the sector have rerated materially with kcab, acl and sira rising by 60 , 59 , and 29 , respectively. in our publication, we highlighted a significant pickup in ceb tendering activity compared to previous years, supporting a more constructive earnings outlook for cable manufacturers. this was evidenced by sira s improved share of ceb tenders alongside a higher aggregate tender value, which translated into strong earnings delivery, with eps growth of 133 yoy and 121 qoq. more recent tender awards point to a further acceleration in ceb activity, with the balance now shifting in favour of acl. as such, acl is increasingly well positioned to emerge as the primary beneficiary of ceb related business in the coming quarters. _cal research_

message_body:
*NESTOR STOCK BROKERS*
*MORNING NEWS BRIEF 6th JANUARY 2026* 

_*Company, Industry & Market News*_

üéô *HNB Assurance welcomes 2026 with strong momentum towards ‚Äò10 in 5‚Äô*

HNB Assurance enters 2026 with strong momentum, focusing on the final phase of its ‚Äò10 in 5‚Äô strategy to achieve a 10% life insurance market share, driven by transformation, innovation, and accelerated growth. Building on a strong 2025 with above-industry growth and multiple local and global awards, the company continues to strengthen its brand, people, partnerships, and customer trust.

https://www.dailymirror.lk/print/business-news/HNB-Assurance-welcomes-2026-with-strong-momentum-towards-10-in-5/273-329542

_*Economic and Government Updates*_

üéô *Tourism arrivals grow by 15% to 2.36 m record high in 2025*

Sri Lanka‚Äôs tourism industry closed 2025 at a historic high with over 2.36 million arrivals, surpassing the 2018 record and marking a strong recovery despite multiple crises over the past six years. December delivered the highest-ever monthly and daily arrivals, reflecting resilient demand and peak-season strength, with India remaining the largest source market.

https://www.ft.lk/top-story/Tourism-arrivals-grow-by-15-to-2-36-m-record-high-in-2025/26-786582

üéô *Sri Lanka records highest-ever workers‚Äô remittances at $ 7.8 b in 2025*

Sri Lanka‚Äôs workers‚Äô remittances reached a historic high of an estimated $7.8 billion in 2025, marking a strong post-crisis recovery with 19% year-on-year growth and surpassing the previous record set in 2016. The rebound reflects renewed confidence among migrant workers, supported by sustained inflows mainly from the Middle East and other key destinations, even as overseas departures slightly declined.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Sri-Lanka-records-highest-ever-workers-remittances-at-7-8-b-in-2025/44-786581

üéô *Gold price rises after US captures Venezuela‚Äôs Maduro*

Global markets saw a flight to safe-haven assets, with gold rising about 2.4% and silver up 4.9% amid heightened geopolitical uncertainty. Defence stocks in Europe and US energy shares gained on expectations of increased military spending and potential access to Venezuela‚Äôs oil reserves, while oil prices remained relatively stable due to ample global supply.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Gold-price-rises-after-US-captures-Venezuela-s-Maduro/44-786578

üéô *Sri Lanka-US trade talks still on: Minister*

Sri Lanka‚ÄìUS trade talks are nearing completion, with about 95% of negotiations concluded, as the Government continues to seek further tariff relief on key exports such as apparel and rubber. While US reciprocal tariffs have been reduced from 44% to 20% in 2025, concerns remain over their potential impact on growth, export earnings, and employment

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Sri-Lanka-US-trade-talks-still-on-Minister/44-786577

_*Global News*_

üéô *Defense stocks drive Asia markets to record highs after U.S. captures Venezuela‚Äôs Maduro*
https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/05/asia-pacific-markets-brent-crude-wti-oil-venezuela-maduro-nikkei-225-hang-seng-index-oil.html

-NESTOR RESEARCH-

message_body:
*Softlogic Stockbrokers*
*News Alert ‚Äì 6th January 2026*

*Local*

*Sri Lanka eyes minimum 3mn tourists in 2026*
Sri Lanka‚Äôs tourism authorities have announced an ambitious minimum target of three million tourist arrivals for 2026, looking to capitalise on the 15 percent growth recorded over the past year. Speaking at a press conference held at the Foreign Affairs Ministry in Colombo yesterday, Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Minister Vijitha Herath outlined a strategic roadmap focused on aggressive regional promotion and policy reforms, to sustain the industry‚Äôs upward trajectory.
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-news/Sri-Lanka-eyes-minimum-3mn-tourists-in-2026/273-329555 

*Asia Siyaka Warehouse sets global benchmark as 1st ZeroCarbon-certified tea logistics company*
Asia Siyaka Warehousing (Pvt.) Ltd, the largest auction logistics provider in Sri Lanka‚Äôs tea sector, has achieved a historic global benchmark in sustainability, becoming the world‚Äôs first and only ZeroCarbon-certified company in tea auction logistics. The achievement was awarded by Sustainable Future Group, Sri Lanka‚Äôs premier sustainability certification body. It highlights the company‚Äôs leadership in environmental stewardship and positions Sri Lanka‚Äôs tea industry at the forefront of sustainable value chains worldwide. 
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-news/Asia-Siyaka-Warehouse-sets-global-benchmark-as-1st-ZeroCarbon-certified-tea-logistics-company/273-329554 

*Sri Lanka records highest-ever workers‚Äô remittances at $ 7.8 b in 2025*
‚Ä¢	Remittances grow 19% YoY and exceed previous 2016 record of $ 7.24 b by 8%
‚Ä¢	Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment Minister Vijitha Herath states Middle Eastern countries remain largest source of inflows, alongside growing contributions from Asia, Europe, and the US
‚Ä¢	Deputy Minister Arun Hemachandra says over 310,000 skilled and 
‚Ä¢	semi-skilled workers left SL in 2025
‚Ä¢	Notes remittance growth continues despite a 1.2% YoY drop in outbound migrant workers in 2025
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Sri-Lanka-records-highest-ever-workers-remittances-at-7-8-b-in-2025/44-786581 

*President makes push for efficient capital spending to drive growth*
‚Ä¢	Instructs Ministry Secretaries to ensure optimal utilisation of 2026 Budget allocations
‚Ä¢	Hints at expenditure remaining within 13% of GDP limit, with 4% allocated for capital expenditure 
‚Ä¢	Notes Rs. 1.4 t allocated in 2026 Budget for capital spending, in addition to Rs. 500 b supplementary allocation for Ditwah relief 
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/President-makes-push-for-efficient-capital-spending-to-drive-growth/44-786579 

*Gold price rises after US captures Venezuela‚Äôs Maduro*
Gold was about 2.4% higher at $ 4,433 (¬£ 3,293) an ounce, while the price of silver was up by 4.9%, as money was moved into so-called ‚Äúsafe-haven‚Äù assets. Defence stocks across Europe also rose in reaction to the weekend‚Äôs events in anticipation of higher spending on the military. The price of oil was little changed, but shares in US energy companies rose in premarket trading on expectations they will get greater access to Venezuela‚Äôs oil reserves.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Gold-price-rises-after-US-captures-Venezuela-s-Maduro/44-786578  

*Digital Motor Insurance Card launch tomorrow*
he Insurance Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (IRCSL), in collaboration with the Insurance Association of Sri Lanka (IASL), will officially launch Sri Lanka‚Äôs Digital Motor Insurance Card, marking a significant milestone in the country‚Äôs digital transformation journey.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Digital-Motor-Insurance-Card-launch-tomorrow/44-786576 

*Ceypetco revises fuel prices from midnight*
The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) has announced a revision of fuel prices with effect from last night. Accordingly, Auto Diesel has been increased by Rs. 2 to Rs. 279 per litre, while Super Diesel has been raised by Rs. 5 to Rs. 323 per litre. Petrol Octane 95 has been increased by Rs. 5 to Rs. 340 per litre, and Kerosene by Rs. 2 to Rs. 182 per litre. Ceypetco said there would be no change in the price of Petrol Octane 92.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Ceypetco-revises-fuel-prices-from-midnight/44-786572 

*Sri Lanka-US trade talks still on: Minister*
‚Ä¢	Foreign Affairs Minister Vijitha Herath says 95% of trade talks done, with negotiations still ongoing
‚Ä¢	Notes Finance and Trade Ministries lead negotiations facilitated by Foreign Ministry
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Sri-Lanka-US-trade-talks-still-on-Minister/44-786577 

*Hatch Fund Singapore makes first investment in Cultive8, a globally scaling agri-tech startup*
Hatch Fund Singapore has announced the completion of its first investment backing Cultive8, a fast-growing agri-technology startup with Sri Lankan roots and a rapidly expanding regional footprint. Hatch is the centre of gravity for Sri Lanka‚Äôs startup and innovation ecosystem, combining co-working, incubation, mentorship, acceleration, partnerships, and venture funding to startups. This milestone investment reflects Hatch‚Äôs commitment to supporting high-potential early winners originating from South Asia and scaling them to global markets.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Hatch-Fund-Singapore-makes-first-investment-in-Cultive8-a-globally-scaling-agri-tech-startup/44-786580 

*Global*

*Dow hits record, energy stocks end higher after US strikes Venezuela*
Wall Street ended higher on Monday, with surging financial shares helping lift the Dow Jones Industrial Average to an all-time peak, while energy firms jumped after a U.S. military strike captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.
https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/us-stock-futures-tick-up-oil-companies-jump-venezuela-shock-2026-01-05/ 

*Ousted Maduro pleads not guilty to US drug charges*
Toppled Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro pleaded not guilty on Monday to narcotics charges after President Donald Trump's stunning capture of him rattled world leaders and left officials in Caracas scrambling to regroup.
https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/venezuelas-maduro-appear-us-court-trump-says-further-strikes-possible-2026-01-05/  



_Softlogic Research_

message_body:
*BRS Newsflash 06.01.2026*

‚Ä¢	Investor interest in diversified financials and construction shares pushed Sri Lanka‚Äôs Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) to close 0.66% higher on Monday, data on its site showed. The broader All Share Price Index (ASPI) closed 150.67 points up at 23,014.75. Meanwhile the more S&P SL20 gained 0.67%, or 41.35 points to close at 6,227.44. Continued retail investor interest in banks stocks were seen in the market. üìâ üíº üìä 
Source: https://economynext.com/sri-lanka-stocks-gain-0-66-pct-on-diversified-financials-construction-shares-255890/



‚Ä¢	President Anura Kumara Dissanayake yesterday said, within the prevailing financial constraints, Budgetary allocations for 2026 have been made by identifying national priorities, and emphasised that it is the responsibility of all Ministry Secretaries and public officials to utilise these funds with maximum efficiency for the benefit of the people. During the discussion, the President further explained that, under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) with the International Monetary Fund (IMF), the Government can allocate only about 13% of GDP for expenditure, of which at least 4% should be reserved for capital expenditure. The Government is the country‚Äôs largest investor, and LKR 1. 4tn has been allocated for capital expenditure, with an additional LKR 500bn set aside for reconstruction work to repair damage caused by the recent Cyclone Ditwah. üìàüößüí∞
Source: https://www.ft.lk/front-page/President-makes-push-for-efficient-capital-spending-to-drive-growth/44-786579

‚Ä¢	Sri Lanka‚Äôs tourism authorities have announced an ambitious minimum target of three million tourist arrivals for 2026, looking to capitalise on the 15 percent growth recorded over the past year. According to the latest data released by the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA), the island nation welcomed a total of 2,362,521 visitors in 2025, a significant 15.1 percent increase, compared to 2,053,465 arrivals recorded in 2024. The momentum continued through the end of the year, with December 2025 seeing 258,928 arrivals, up 4.2 percent, from 248,592 recorded in the same month the previous year.üß≥‚úàÔ∏è
Source: https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-news/Sri-Lanka-eyes-minimum-3mn-tourists-in-2026/273-329555


‚Ä¢	Sri Lanka‚Äôs workers‚Äô remittances surged to a historic high of an estimated USD 7.8bn in 2025, marking the largest annual inflow ever recorded and underscoring a strong post-crisis recovery in external foreign exchange earnings. Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism Minister Vijitha Herath announced the milestone yesterday, noting that the figure surpasses the previous decade-high of USD 7.24bn achieved in 2016. The 2025 performance reflects an 8% increase over that earlier record and a robust 19% year-on-year (YoY) growth, despite the Central Bank yet to formally confirm December inflows. üíµüìà
Source: https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Sri-Lanka-records-highest-ever-workers-remittances-at-7-8-b-in-2025/44-786581



‚Ä¢	The Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Ministry said business registration for export, manufacturing, and other enterprises affected by Cyclone Ditwah has resumed under a second phase and will be extended until 16 January. The Ministry said the registration was restarted following requests from manufacturing and small-scale industrial operators. üè≠
Source: https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Registration-of-Ditwah-hit-businesses-for-Rs-200-000-relief-extended-to-16-Jan/44-786574



‚Ä¢	The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) has announced a revision of fuel prices with effect from last night. Accordingly, Auto Diesel has been increased by LKR 2 to LKR 279 per litre, while Super Diesel has been raised by LKR 5 to LKR 323 per litre. Petrol Octane 95 has been increased by LKR 5 to LKR 340 per litre, and Kerosene by LKR 2 to LKR 182 per litre. Ceypetco said there would be no change in the price of Petrol Octane 92. ‚õΩ
Source: https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Ceypetco-revises-fuel-prices-from-midnight/44-786572


*BRS Equity Research*

benefit of the people. during the discussion, the president further explained that, under the extended fund facility eff with the international monetary fund imf , the government can allocate only about 13 of gdp for expenditure, of which at least 4 should be reserved for capital expenditure. the government is the country s largest investor, and lkr 1. 4tn has been allocated for capital expenditure, with an additional lkr 500bn set aside for reconstruction work to repair damage caused by the recent cyclone ditwah. money money source: sri lanka s tourism authorities have announced an ambitious minimum target of three million tourist arrivals for 2026, looking to capitalise on the 15 percent growth recorded over the past year. according to the latest data released by the sri lanka tourism development authority sltda , the island nation welcomed a total of 2,362,521 visitors in 2025, a significant 15.1 percent increase, compared to 2,053,465 arrivals recorded in 2024. the momentum continued through the end of the year, with december 2025 seeing 258,928 arrivals, up 4.2 percent, from 248,592 recorded in the same month the previous year. source: sri lanka s workers remittances surged to a historic high of an estimated usd 7.8bn in 2025, marking the largest annual inflow ever recorded and underscoring a strong post crisis recovery in external foreign exchange earnings. foreign affairs, foreign employment, and tourism minister vijitha herath announced the milestone yesterday, noting that the figure surpasses the previous decade high of usd 7.24bn achieved in 2016. the 2025 performance reflects an 8 increase over that earlier record and a robust 19 year on year yoy growth, despite the central bank yet to formally confirm december inflows. money money source: the industry and entrepreneurship development ministry said business registration for export, manufacturing, and other enterprises affected by cyclone ditwah has resumed under a second phase and will be extended until 16 january. the ministry said the registration was restarted following requests from manufacturing and small scale industrial operators. source: the ceylon petroleum corporation ceypetco has announced a revision of fuel prices with effect from last night. accordingly, auto diesel has been increased by lkr 2 to lkr 279 per litre, while super diesel has been raised by lkr 5 to lkr 323 per litre. petrol octane 95 has been increased by lkr 5 to lkr 340 per litre, and kerosene by lkr 2 to lkr 182 per litre. ceypetco said there would be no change in the price of petrol octane 92. source: brs equity research

message_body:
*ACL Earnings Review 2Q FY26 / Bartleet Religare Securities ‚Äì 30.12.2025*

‚öñ *Earnings Set to Surge on Volume Growth Fuel by Expanding Order Book*

üí∞ EPS of LKR 6.19 (pre-subdivision) for 2Q FY26, with PATMI reaching LKR 1.5bn (+38.8% YoY), driven by sales growth of 19.9% YoY and 15.0% QoQ.

üèó *Local sales led the revenue growth* : Local sales increased 24% YoY to LKR 9.1bn, while export sales grew 7% YoY to LKR 2.3bn. Growth was primarily volume-driven, with institutional demand from CEB contributing significantly to topline momentum.

üì¶ *Capacity well-positioned to capture demand growth:* Utilization stood at 60% in 2Q FY26 and is expected to rise to 71‚Äì74% over FY27‚ÄìFY28. ACL is well-positioned to capture post-Cyclone Ditwah reconstruction demand, supported by its dealer network, institutional projects, and rising government capital expenditure, enabling accelerated revenue growth in the near term.

ü™ô *Price adjustments expected amid cost pressures:* Sustained high copper prices (USD 12,200+/MT) and a depreciating LKR point to near-term price revisions, supporting revenue growth while mitigating margin pressures.

üìà *Valuation & recommendation* : A blended DCF and PER approach yields a FY27E target price of LKR 154.00 (+81.8% upside). With a forward PER of 5.5x, the market has yet to fully reflect ACL‚Äôs growth potential.

*Recommendation: BUY*

üîó *Full report:* https://research.bartleetreligare.com/reports/acl-earnings-review-2q-fy26-buy-1625

The market now approaches key resistance layers that will determine whether the upside can sustain or transition into consolidation in the coming sessions.

üü£ Insight

The index extended its upside follow-through after reclaiming key support levels and sustaining strength across the intraday and daily structures. Momentum strengthened as price remained above short-term moving averages while RSI and MACD readings signaled continued buying pressure. The short-term focus remains on whether price can build acceptance above immediate resistance layers and maintain trend stability without violating support. Sustained closes above resistance will improve the probability of momentum continuation, while failure to hold support may slow upside extension and shift bias toward consolidation.

message_body:
*NESTOR STOCK BROKERS*
*MORNING NEWS BRIEF 5th JANUARY 2026* 

_*Company, Industry & Market News*_

üéô *Sarvodaya Development Finance and FINAP launch CIXOR PayDay, a next-generation WageTech solution for on-demand salary access*

Sarvodaya Development Finance PLC, together with FINAP, has launched CIXOR PayDay, a digital WageTech platform that allows employees to access a portion of their earned wages in real time as a financial wellness solution rather than a loan. The platform helps salaried and wage earners manage short-term cash-flow needs while offering employers a capital-efficient, end-of-cycle settlement model.

https://bizenglish.adaderana.lk/sarvodaya-development-finance-and-finap-launch-cixor-payday-a-next-generation-wagetech-solution-for-on-demand-salary-access/

üéô *Ferentino Tyres redefines OEM tyre market in Sri Lanka with 75% value share*

Ferentino Tyres has become the clear leader in Sri Lanka‚Äôs OEM tyre market, securing a dominant 75% value share by earning the trust of major automobile manufacturers. Through consistent quality, safety, and performance, the company has partnered with leading automotive brands, setting new industry benchmarks. Looking ahead, Ferentino aims to expand internationally, showcasing Sri Lankan manufacturing excellence on the global stage.

https://www.ft.lk/business/Ferentino-Tyres-redefines-OEM-tyre-market-in-Sri-Lanka-with-75-value-share/34-786422

_*Economic and Government Updates*_

üéô *Rupee depreciates 5.6% against USD in 2025*

Sri Lanka‚Äôs rupee depreciated by 5.6% in 2025, reversing the strong appreciation seen in 2023‚Äì2024, reflecting a shift to a more flexible exchange-rate regime rather than crisis-driven pressure. Analysts attribute the weakening to normalising import demand, external debt-related outflows, and reduced intervention, following the sharp 2022 currency collapse.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Rupee-depreciates-5-6-against-USD-in-2025/44-786522

üéô *Private sector lending rates increase as FD returns fall*

Private sector lending rates remained elevated in 2025 despite policy easing, as strong credit demand and risk considerations limited the pass-through to lending rates. While Treasury Bill yields and fixed deposit rates declined sharply in line with lower policy rates, the AWPLR firmed amid record-high private sector credit growth. This divergence reflects sticky lending conditions driven by rising borrowing demand, even as deposit and government security rates adjusted downward.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Private-sector-lending-rates-increase-as-FD-returns-fall/44-786520

üéô *Finance company sector assets up 35% YoY to Rs. 2.49 t by Q3 2025*

The Non-Bank Finance Company sector recorded strong expansion by end-September 2025, driven by a sharp rise in loans and advances, which boosted assets and profitability despite higher leverage. Asset quality improved significantly with a notable decline in Stage 3 loans and stronger impairment coverage, while earnings and returns rose sharply year-on-year.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Finance-company-sector-assets-up-35-YoY-to-Rs-2-49-t-by-Q3-2025/44-786464

üéô *Coconut exports cross $1 b in 2025*

Sri Lanka‚Äôs coconut sector achieved a record performance in 2025, with export earnings surpassing $ 1 billion and projected to reach about $ 1.2 billion, reflecting over 40% year-on-year growth. The surge was driven by coordinated government action, controlled re-export imports, and behavioural changes that improved domestic efficiency while sustaining export momentum.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Coconut-exports-cross-1-b-in-2025/44-786461

üéô *2025 to set tea export record?*

Sri Lanka‚Äôs tea exports recorded year-on-year growth in 2025, with volumes rising to 239 million kg and export earnings increasing to about $ 1.4 billion up to November. While export performance remained strong in both quantity and value terms, prices softened toward year-end amid slower European demand. However, tea production is expected to decline in December 2025 due to Cyclone Ditwah, potentially offsetting earlier gains and leaving full-year output close to 2024 levels.

https://www.themorning.lk/articles/tPr2N9iRMCF6t3tIDtIR

üéô *FACETS Sri Lanka 2026 ushers next phase of growth for gem and jewellery industry*

FACETS Sri Lanka 2026 was inaugurated at Cinnamon Life, City of Dreams, marking a milestone for Asia‚Äôs premier gem and jewellery exhibition and reinforcing Sri Lanka‚Äôs position in the global trade. Now in its 33rd edition, the event blends the country‚Äôs rich gem heritage with innovation, sustainability, and immersive experiences, attracting international buyers and industry leaders.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/FACETS-Sri-Lanka-2026-ushers-next-phase-of-growth-for-gem-and-jewellery-industry/44-786521

_*Global News*_

üéô *Asian markets rise, defense stocks lead after after U.S. captures Venezuela‚Äôs Maduro*
https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/05/asia-pacific-markets-brent-crude-wti-oil-venezuela-maduro-nikkei-225-hang-seng-index-oil.html

*Rupee depreciates 5.6% against USD in 2025*
Lanka‚Äôs rupee weakened against the US dollar in 2025, posting an annual depreciation of 5.6%, reversing the strong gains recorded over the previous two years.

*FACETS Sri Lanka 2026 ushers next phase of growth for gem and jewellery industry*
FACETS Sri Lanka 2026 was officially inaugurated on Saturday at Cinnamon Life at City of Dreams, marking a significant milestone for Asia‚Äôs premier gem and jewellery exhibition. 
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/FACETS-Sri-Lanka-2026-ushers-next-phase-of-growth-for-gem-and-jewellery-industry/44-786521

*Private sector lending rates increase as FD returns fall*
Private sector lending rates remained elevated in 2025 as demand for credit improved even as returns on bank fixed deposits declined in line with benchmark Treasury Bill rates. 
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Private-sector-lending-rates-increase-as-FD-returns-fall/44-786520

*Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill gazetted for legislative approval*
Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill has been published in the Government Gazette, paving the way for the abolition of pension entitlements granted to Members of Parliament and their spouses under existing law.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Parliamentary-Pensions-Repeal-Bill-gazetted-for-legislative-approval/44-786518

*New casino entry levy, betting and gaming taxes come into effect*
The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has announced that a series of tax increases on Sri Lanka‚Äôs betting and gaming sector came into effect from 1 January, following amendments to the Betting and Gaming Levy Act, No. 40 of 1988, under the Betting and Gaming Levy (Amendment) Act, No. 25 of 2025.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/New-casino-entry-levy-betting-and-gaming-taxes-come-into-effect/44-786515

*Recovery and reconstruction to drive 2026 growth: CBSL*
Sri Lanka can expect to see growth driven by Cyclone Ditwah recovery and rebuilding expenditure, as public investments are expected to increase by roughly 35.7% in 2026 due to the Rs. 500 billion allocated towards it, Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe said recently (02), speaking on Ada Derana‚Äôs Hydepark with Indeewari Amuwatte programme.
https://www.themorning.lk/articles/xYLVF3SFm8e7BIzgLYaP

*Port of Colombo records historic high of 8.29 m TEUs in 2025*
The Port of Colombo recorded a container throughput of 8,291,178 TEUs in 2025, marking the highest annual volume handled by the port. This followed a throughput of 7,792,069 TEUs in 2024, reflecting year-on-year growth amid uneven global trade conditions.

message_body:
‚Ä¢	Sri Lanka‚Äôs macro environment strengthened in 2025, driven by fiscal consolidation, a ~37% YoY rise in tax revenue, a sharply narrower fiscal deficit, and low inflation of 2.1% YoY.
‚Ä¢	Economic growth accelerated, with GDP expanding 5.4% YoY in 3Q2025, supported by accommodative monetary policy and strong private sector credit growth of 24.1% YoY in Oct‚Äô25.
‚Ä¢	Despite a wider trade deficit, external sector stability was reinforced by higher remittances, recovering tourism earnings, and improving foreign reserve buffers.
‚Ä¢	The economy showed resilience following Cyclone Ditwah, with swift policy action and multilateral support containing disruptions and preserving the reform-led recovery momentum.
‚Ä¢	The Colombo Stock Exchange delivered a strong 41.9% YoY gain in 2025, driven by broad-based earnings growth, improving fundamentals, and declining interest rates. 
‚Ä¢	Valuations remain attractive, with the CSE trading at a discount to regional peers, offering re-rating potential across fundamentally strong sectors.
* Several fundamentally strong counters trade below market PER and book value, highlighting selective deep-value opportunities.
* Several counters deliver DYs above the 12-month T-Bill rate, enhancing total return potential in a low-rate environment.
* Banking-heavy SL20 constituents trade at some of the lowest multiples in the market, while delivering strong ROEs and earnings leadership.
* Banks, NBFIs, Insurance, and Construction dominate TTM profits, combining scale, profitability, and reasonable valuations.
* The majority of listed counters recorded positive price gains in 2025, alongside limited decliners, reflect improving market breadth and investor confidence.

_Softlogic Research_
author: 139874216714373@lid

message_body:
üå¥ A HISTORIC FIRST FOR SRI LANKA‚ÄôS COCONUT INDUSTRY üåç

üá±üá∞ USD 1.13 BILLION in coconut export earnings achieved during January‚ÄìNovember 2025, marking the highest export performance ever recorded in the history of Sri Lanka‚Äôs coconut sector.

üìà This remarkable milestone reflects a +44% growth compared to the same period in 2024‚Äîdriven by strong global demand, expanding value-added exports, and the resilience of our coconut industry.

‚ú® What this achievement signifies
‚Ä¢ A powerful shift from bulk exports to high-value, market-driven coconut products
‚Ä¢ 7.1% contribution to Sri Lanka‚Äôs total national export earnings
‚Ä¢ Growing global recognition of Sri Lanka‚Äôs premium Golden Coconut

ü§ù This success belongs to the entire coconut value chain‚Äî
our growers, processors, exporters, researchers, policymakers, and industry partners‚Äîwhose collective efforts have transformed national potential into global performance.

üîÆ Looking ahead
With a clear vision and sustained momentum, Sri Lanka is on course to build a
üèÜ USD 2.5 BILLION Coconut Export Economy by 2030.

üå± The Coconut Development Authority remains committed to:
‚Ä¢ Empowering coconut growers
‚Ä¢ Strengthening value-added industries
‚Ä¢ Expanding Sri Lanka‚Äôs global market footprint
‚Ä¢ Driving sustainable, data-driven growth for the sector

üá±üá∞ From farm to global markets ‚Äî the journey of Sri Lanka‚Äôs Golden Coconut continues.

#CoconutIndustry #ExportMilestone #ValueAddedExports #Vision2030

message_body:
BREAKING: President Donald J. Trump confirms ‚ÄúU.S. successfully carried out strikes in Venezuela,‚Äù as Maduro claims his wife was captured.

And once again, people think this is about politics‚Ä¶
or drugs‚Ä¶
or personalities.

It isn‚Äôt.

I‚Äôve watched this movie before.

I Saw the Same Pattern With Saddam Hussein

In 2000, Saddam Hussein made a decision most people didn‚Äôt understand at the time.

He announced Iraq would sell oil in euros instead of U.S. dollars.

Three years later, Iraq was invaded.

No weapons of mass destruction were found.

But one thing did change quickly:
"Iraqi oil went right back to being sold in U.S. dollars."

People called it coincidence.

I called it financial reality.

This Is How Modern Conflict Actually Starts

Wars today don‚Äôt begin with bombs.
They begin with money.

The pattern is always the same:

‚Ä¢ A country becomes financially isolated
‚Ä¢ Sanctions restrict trade
‚Ä¢ Currency collapses under inflation
‚Ä¢ Foreign reserves dry up
‚Ä¢ Energy exports become political
‚Ä¢ Payment systems turn into weapons

By the time you see ‚ÄúBREAKING NEWS,‚Äù the economic war is already over.

What follows is instability, confusion, emergency powers, and force.

Why Venezuela Keeps Reappearing?

Not ideology.
Not leadership style.

Oil.

Venezuela holds one of the largest proven oil reserves on Earth.

Oil isn‚Äôt just energy.

Oil creates currency demand.

When a country with massive energy reserves becomes financially isolated ‚Äî especially from the dollar system ‚Äî pressure builds.

Quietly at first.
Then suddenly.

In the 21st century, power doesn‚Äôt come from armies alone.

It comes from systems:

‚Ä¢ Payment rails
‚Ä¢ Trade insurance
‚Ä¢ Settlement networks
‚Ä¢ Currency access
‚Ä¢ Reserve status

You can have tanks, jets, and soldiers‚Ä¶

But if:

‚Ä¢ your reserves are frozen
‚Ä¢ your oil can‚Äôt be insured
‚Ä¢ your currency can‚Äôt settle trades
‚Ä¢ your access to global payments is restricted

You don‚Äôt control your country anymore.

This isn‚Äôt just about Venezuela.

Countries around the world are paying attention because the lesson is clear:

If your money runs on someone else‚Äôs system, you are not sovereign.

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre seeing:

‚Ä¢ BRICS expanding
‚Ä¢ Alternative payment systems accelerating
‚Ä¢ Central banks buying record amounts of gold
‚Ä¢ Local currency trade agreements increasing
‚Ä¢ Quiet reductions in dollar exposure

Not because the dollar is ‚Äúbad.‚Äù

Because dependency is dangerous.

What My Rich Dad Taught Me About Times Like This

He said:
‚ÄúWhen money becomes political, citizens lose first.‚Äù

That‚Äôs why I never trusted:

‚Ä¢ paper savings
‚Ä¢ pensions
‚Ä¢ government guarantees

And why I continue to hold real assets:

Gold.
Silver.
Bitcoin.

Not because I want chaos.

Because chaos follows broken money, not the other way around.

The Real Warning Isn‚Äôt Venezuela

The real warning is this:

When financial pressure reaches a tipping point,
events stop being slow‚Ä¶
and start happening fast.

Most people react after stability is gone.

The educated prepare before the headlines.

History doesn‚Äôt repeat perfectly ‚Äî
but it rhymes with brutal accuracy.

Take care.
-Robert kiyosaki-

message_body:
*ACL Earnings Review 2Q FY26 / Bartleet Religare Securities ‚Äì 30.12.2025*

‚öñ *Earnings Set to Surge on Volume Growth Fuel by Expanding Order Book*

üí∞ EPS of LKR 6.19 (pre-subdivision) for 2Q FY26, with PATMI reaching LKR 1.5bn (+38.8% YoY), driven by sales growth of 19.9% YoY and 15.0% QoQ.

üèó *Local sales led the revenue growth* : Local sales increased 24% YoY to LKR 9.1bn, while export sales grew 7% YoY to LKR 2.3bn. Growth was primarily volume-driven, with institutional demand from CEB contributing significantly to topline momentum.

üì¶ *Capacity well-positioned to capture demand growth:* Utilization stood at 60% in 2Q FY26 and is expected to rise to 71‚Äì74% over FY27‚ÄìFY28. ACL is well-positioned to capture post-Cyclone Ditwah reconstruction demand, supported by its dealer network, institutional projects, and rising government capital expenditure, enabling accelerated revenue growth in the near term.

ü™ô *Price adjustments expected amid cost pressures:* Sustained high copper prices (USD 12,200+/MT) and a depreciating LKR point to near-term price revisions, supporting revenue growth while mitigating margin pressures.

üìà *Valuation & recommendation* : A blended DCF and PER approach yields a FY27E target price of LKR 154.00 (+81.8% upside). With a forward PER of 5.5x, the market has yet to fully reflect ACL‚Äôs growth potential.

*Recommendation: BUY*

üîó *Full report:* https://research.bartleetreligare.com/reports/acl-earnings-review-2q-fy26-buy-1625

*We are pleased to share key highlights from CSE 2025 ‚Äì Retrospective* üìä
*‚ÄúA Year of Resilience and Momentum with Record Highs Across Indices and Turnover‚Äù*

üìà *Market Performance*
ASPI closed 2025 at 22,624.31, delivering a strong annual gain of +41.9%.*
S&P SL20 ended 2025 at 6,157.38, recording an annual return of +26.6%

üí∞ *Historic Turnover*
2025 marked the highest-ever market turnover of LKR 1,233bn, surpassing the previous record of LKR 1,173bn set in 2021.

üå± *Key Market Drivers*
Low interest rates, strong investor momentum, solid earnings growth, and a supportive domestic macroeconomic environment underpinned the market‚Äôs advance.

üöÄ *Primary Market Activities*
The year also witnessed strong IPO oversubscriptions, reflecting healthy investor participation and confidence.

üîó *Full Report*
Click the link below for deeper insights into CSE performance and key themes in 2025:
üëâhttps://research.bartleetreligare.com/reports/brs-equity-research-2025-retrospective-1627

Stay with us in 2026 as we continue to deliver timely insights and uncover new investment opportunities.

*Warm regards,*

message_body:
We are pleased to bring you the *BRS Equity Strategy for 2026E.*

üìò *Rebuilding Sri Lanka: The 2026E Selective Equity Opportunity*: _*Bartleet Religare Securities: 31.12.2025*_

üéØ *Strategy ‚Äì Selective Overweight*
We favour *selective overweight exposure to reconstruction- and consumption-linked sectors*. While *near-term upside is modest, medium-term returns remain intact* as earnings and valuations normalise.

üå™Ô∏è *From Shock to Recovery*
Cyclone Ditwah is expected to *pressure earnings through 1H 2026E*. A *multilateral-backed reconstruction phase* should begin support activity from *2H 2026E*, driving a *sector-led recovery* through 2027E.

‚öñÔ∏è *Supportive Backdrop*
Stable interest rates, *tax-exempt capital gains*, and *sustainable liquidity* continue to support equities.

üìä *Earnings & Valuation*
* *Earnings:* +10% in *2026E* (LKR *765bn*), +14% in *2027E* (LKR *872bn*)
* *ASPI targets: 23,500 (2026E) | 27,000 (2027E)*

üß≠ *BRS Recommended Portfolio*
üèóÔ∏è _Construction & Related:_ AEL, ACL, SIRA, CIND, TKYO
üõí _Consumption:_ HHL, CIC, DIST
üè¶ _Financials:_ COMB, HNB(X), COCR
üè≠ HAYC | üöï PKME | üí∞ LLUB

‚ö†Ô∏è *Risks:* Fiscal slippages | Funding gaps | Inflation | Monetary tightening

üîó Full report: https://research.bartleetreligare.com/reports/rebuilding-sri-lanka-the-2026e-selective-equity-opportunity-1626

*Wishing you a prosperous New Year filled with disciplined investing, informed decisions, and rewarding opportunities.*

*Warm regards,*
*BRS Equity Research*

message_body:
*NESTOR STOCK BROKERS*
*MORNING NEWS BRIEF 2nd JANUARY 2026* 
_*NEW YEAR üòÅ SMART DECISIONS üí°- Setting the Stage for 2026*_

_*Company, Industry & Market News*_

üéô *Kapruka says Partner Central project undershoots budget by Rs. 110.7 m*

Kapruka Holdings PLC has completed its IPO-funded Partner Central e-commerce platform significantly below budget, leaving Rs. 110.7 million unutilised due to in-house development efficiencies. The Board proposes reallocating the excess funds to working capital to strengthen financial stability and support future growth, subject to shareholder approval at an EGM.

https://www.ft.lk/business/Kapruka-says-Partner-Central-project-undershoots-budget-by-Rs-110-7-m/34-786336

üéô *Myland gets new Chairperson*

Myland Developments PLC has appointed Independent Non-Executive Director Savanth Sebastian as Chairperson of its Board. He brings over 21 years of experience in economics, financial services and investment management, with senior roles at Commonwealth Bank Australia and multiple listed companies in Sri Lanka.

https://www.ft.lk/business/Myland-gets-new-Chairperson/34-786295

üéô *Hayleys mandatory offer for Harischandra Mills ends with minimal acceptance*

Hayleys PLC‚Äôs mandatory offer to acquire the remaining shares of Harischandra Mills PLC concluded on December 30, 2025, with very low shareholder acceptance of just 0.06 percent. As a result, Hayleys‚Äô stake increased marginally to 40.64 percent, despite the offer price of Rs. 3,300 being significantly below the market price.

https://www.dailymirror.lk/print/business/Hayleys-mandatory-offer-for-Harischandra-Mills-ends-with-minimal-acceptance/215-329261

üéô *Siyapatha Finance appoints new CEO*

Siyapatha Finance PLC has appointed Mathisha Hewavitharana as Chief Executive Officer with effect from 1 January 2026, succeeding long-serving Managing Director Ananda Seneviratne. A long-standing internal leader, Hewavitharana joined the company in 2005 and most recently served as Chief Strategy Officer, reflecting Siyapatha‚Äôs strong focus on internal talent development.

https://www.themorning.lk/articles/Iirb268z78O311KzCe5M

_*Economic and Government Updates*_

üéô *Vehicle imports rebound to second highest month in Nov. 2025; reach $ 1.7 b YTD*

Sri Lanka‚Äôs vehicle import surge continued in November 2025, lifting cumulative imports to $1.7 billion, though CBSL says post-liberalisation pent-up demand is now easing. While vehicle imports boosted Government revenue in 2025, both CBSL and the CoPF expect demand and related revenues to moderate in 2026.

https://www.ft.lk/top-story/Vehicle-imports-rebound-to-second-highest-month-in-Nov-2025-reach-1-7-b-YTD/26-786373

üéô *Current account returns to surplus in November amid external sector pressures*

Sri Lanka‚Äôs current account returned to a surplus of $81.7 million in November 2025, though the year-to-date surplus narrowed to $1.67 billion amid faster import growth and rising vehicle imports. Higher remittances and tourism earnings supported the external position, but the trade deficit widened as imports outpaced exports.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Current-account-returns-to-surplus-in-November-amid-external-sector-pressures/44-786383

üéô *Inflation: CCPI unchanged in Dec.*

Sri Lanka‚Äôs headline inflation, measured by the CCPI, remained unchanged at 2.1% year-on-year in December 2025, with food inflation steady while non-food inflation edged up slightly. Core inflation accelerated to 2.7%, signalling strengthening underlying price pressures. Authorities expect inflation to gradually rise towards the 5% target in the period ahead under appropriate policy support.

https://www.themorning.lk/articles/YOGUAoBqAlrXsR07AkbK

üéô *Construction PMI expands*

Sri Lanka‚Äôs PMI for Construction remained in expansion territory in November 2025, with the Total Activity Index at 66.2, despite a slight month-on-month decline. Construction activity was supported by increased private and Government-funded projects, while new orders, employment, and purchases continued to improve.

https://www.themorning.lk/articles/Feg5BHz5v4rZQrfMkzdT

_*Global News*_

üéô *South Korea‚Äôs Kospi hit record high as region trades mixed at the start of 2026*
https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/02/asia-pacific-markets-asx-200-hang-seng-index.html

_*-NESTOR RESEARCH-*_

message_body:
*NBFIs Show Signs of Stability in 3QCY25; Could Stay Among Investor Favorites in CY26* 

Non-Bank Finance Companies (NBFIs) have continued to stabilize in 3QCY25, according to the Central Bank‚Äôs Financial Soundness Indicators, strengthening further their balance sheets while increasing earnings potential. 

Key highlights through 3Q include continued asset growth supported by loans and leases expansion, alongside improving profitability, driven by easing funding costs and better pricing.

Importantly, asset quality indicators showed signs of stabilization, while capital adequacy levels remained above regulatory requirements, providing a necessary buffer as credit demand picks up. 

*Why This Matters For Investors:*

A more stable and better-capitalized finance companies sector is well-positioned to benefit from the prolonged low interest rate environment, which can cater to the growing demand for leasing, consumer, and Micro and SME-focused credit products. 

As credit costs normalize and balance sheets strengthen, earnings visibility is improving, creating room for improved valuations and selective re-rating among fundamentally stronger finance companies.

Hence, we expect the NBFI Trade to continue to power the stock market gains going into CY26.
author: 266082417922092@lid

message_body: In 2025, Merchant Bank of Sri Lanka & Finance PLC (MBSL) has adopted an assertive growth strategy, actively relocating its branch network to strengthen market presence and attract a broader client base. As part of this expansion plan, the bank has identified strategic opportunities to relocate 11 branches to more commercially advantageous locations during the year to improve accessibility, drive customer acquisition, and support future business growth. MBSL ‚Äî historically a significant financial institution with strong ties to Bank of Ceylon (BOC) ‚Äî is increasingly focused on enhancing its competitive position in Sri Lanka‚Äôs non banking sector. While market sentiment around its share performance has been dynamic, with the stock trading around Rs. 17.50 in recent weeks, underlying efforts to expand physical and market footprint reflect its intention to re-energize growth and client engagement across core segments.
