message_body:
*NESTOR STOCK BROKERS*
*MORNING NEWS BRIEF 31st DECEMBER 2025*

_*Company ,Industry & Market News*_

üéô *Panasian Power connects 5MW solar unit to national grid*

Panasian Power PLC has successfully connected its 5 MW ground-mounted solar power project in Baddegama, Galle, to the national grid on 30 December 2025, completing the final project under a batch of seven solar plants approved in Q3 2024. The project adds 5 MW AC (6.76 MWp DC) capacity and has commenced revenue generation through a subsidiary.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Panasian-Power-connects-5MW-solar-unit-to-national-grid/44-786275

üéô *Galadari hotel project implementation extended by 1 year as rebranding takes shape*

Galadari Hotels (Lanka) PLC has extended the implementation period of its hotel refurbishment project by 12 months to November 9, 2026, under a supplementary agreement with the BOI. The project involves a full transformation and rebranding of the property as Radisson Blu Hotel Galadari Colombo, including major renovations and a management handover. 

https://www.dailymirror.lk/print/business-news/Galadari-hotel-project-implementation-extended-by-1-year-as-rebranding-takes-shape/273-329056

üéô *ComBank-Mastercard launch Sri Lanka‚Äôs first Dynamic Currency Conversion for online payments*

Commercial Bank of Ceylon, in partnership with Mastercard, has introduced Sri Lanka‚Äôs first Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) capability for online payments via the Mastercard Payment Gateway Services platform. The service allows international customers to pay in their home currency with full cost transparency, benefiting tourism, travel and hospitality merchants.

https://www.dailymirror.lk/print/business-news/ComBank-Mastercard-launch-Sri-Lankas-first-Dynamic-Currency-Conversion-for-online-payments/273-329050

_*Economic and Government Updates*_

üéô *Sri Lanka eyes 3 m tourist arrivals and $ 5 b revenue in 2026*

Sri Lanka Tourism Chairman Buddhika Hewawasam expects 2025 to close with around 2.35 million tourist arrivals and $ 3‚Äì4 billion in revenue, surpassing the 2018 record despite economic challenges and Cyclone Ditwah. He noted the strong year-end momentum and highlighted tourism‚Äôs rapid recovery, which reinforced international confidence in Sri Lanka as a destination.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Sri-Lanka-eyes-3-m-tourist-arrivals-and-5-b-revenue-in-2026/44-786278

üéô *Port City Colombo signals new phase of investment and commercial growth*

Port City Colombo marked its 11th anniversary with master developer CHEC reaffirming its long-term commitment to attracting foreign direct investment and advancing key infrastructure milestones. Launched in 2014, the 269-hectare development has entered a new phase of commercial operations and vertical construction, reflecting confidence in Sri Lanka‚Äôs regional potential.

https://dailynews.lk/2025/12/31/business/924561/port-city-colombo-signals-new-phase-of-investment-and-commercial-growth/

üéô *Tax revenue: SL Customs posts 65% increase*

Sri Lanka Customs has recorded a 65% increase in revenue, reaching Rs. 2,497 billion by December 29, surpassing both the original and revised targets for the year. The revenue growth was driven by internal efficiency measures and the resumption of vehicle imports, which significantly boosted collections. The performance marks a sharp rise from last year‚Äôs revenue target of Rs. 1,531 billion.

https://www.themorning.lk/articles/20YXjsxULvQ0xhNX0t3j

_*Global News*_

üéô *Asia-Pacific markets open lower in year-end trade*
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/31/asia-pacific-markets-hang-seng-index-nifty-50-csi-300.html

-NESTOR RESEARCH-

message_body:
*NESTOR STOCK BROKERS*
*MORNING NEWS BRIEF 30th DECEMBER 2025*

_*Company ,Industry & Market News*_

üéô *Colombo Dockyard‚Äôs march towards Maldivian leisure industry*

Colombo Dockyard PLC has established itself as a market leader in the niche underwater structures segment, successfully delivering multiple underwater restaurant and gallery projects for leading Maldivian resorts since 2018. Its portfolio includes the largest underwater restaurant in the Maldives and the newest addition opened in December 2025, highlighting strong technical expertise and innovation.

https://www.ft.lk/business/Colombo-Dockyard-s-march-towards-Maldivian-leisure-industry/34-786250

üéô *Chinthaka Dharmasena joins Commercial Development Co. Board*

Commercial Development Company PLC has appointed Chinthaka Dharmasena as a Non-Executive Director, strengthening the board with his extensive expertise in operations, supply chain management, and sustainability. He brings significant leadership experience from Commercial Bank of Ceylon PLC, where he played a pivotal role in achieving carbon-neutral status and advancing green initiatives.

https://www.ft.lk/business/Chinthaka-Dharmasena-joins-Commercial-Development-Co-Board/34-786252

üéô *WTS Rs. 500 m IPO oversubscribed by 14.9 times*

The WealthTrust Securities Ltd. IPO of Rs. 500 million was heavily oversubscribed by 14.9 times, attracting applications worth Rs. 7.5 billion and reflecting strong investor confidence. The offer of 71.5 million shares at Rs. 7 each was fully subscribed on the opening day itself, leading to an early closure.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/WTS-Rs-500-m-IPO-oversubscribed-by-14-9-times/44-786258

üéô *Sunshine Holdings sets standard for workplace excellence*

Sunshine Holdings PLC has partnered with Great Place To Work (GPTW) to strengthen its employee experience, using surveys, pulse checks, and feedback platforms to address needs for clarity, trust, and belonging. Initiatives such as enhanced onboarding, career clinics, recognition programs, and tailored unit-level interventions have improved retention, talent alignment, and workplace culture, earning Sunshine recurring GPTW Certification.

https://www.dailymirror.lk/print/business-news/Sunshine-Holdings-sets-standard-for-workplace-excellence/273-328957

_*Economic and Government Updates*_

üéô *Apparel exports up 5.42% in first 11 months despite slight dip in November*

Sri Lanka‚Äôs apparel industry showed resilient growth during the first 11 months of 2025, with cumulative exports reaching $4,571.99 million, up 5.42% from the same period in 2024. While November 2025 exports saw a slight decline of 1.96% to $367.60 million, key markets such as the US and EU demonstrated strong year-to-date growth of 1.73% and 13.07% respectively, reflecting the sector‚Äôs competitiveness and focus on sustainability.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Apparel-exports-up-5-42-in-first-11-months-despite-slight-dip-in-November/44-786264

üéô *IMF sees reserves up 7% in 2025 to $ 6.5 b; current account to turn deficit in 2026*

The IMF projects Sri Lanka‚Äôs gross official reserves to rise modestly to $6.55 billion by end-2025, before accelerating to $8.9 billion in 2026 and $13.4 billion in 2027, supported by continued program implementation and external financing. External debt is expected to fall 6.5% to $53.4 billion in 2025 due to restructuring, before increasing again in 2026‚Äì2027 as financing needs rise.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/IMF-sees-reserves-up-7-in-2025-to-6-5-b-current-account-to-turn-deficit-in-2026/44-786259#

üéô *Migration likely to cross 300,000*

Sri Lanka‚Äôs annual migration is set to exceed 300,000 individuals in 2025, continuing the high levels seen during the 2022 economic crisis, according to SLBFE Chairperson Koshala Wickremasinghe. Key destinations for migrants include Kuwait, UAE, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and Israel, while the country has received $712 million in workers‚Äô remittances in the first ten months, marking a 20.1% year-on-year increase.

https://www.themorning.lk/articles/3rDVeljhRT3H5VYe1QNN

üéô *Active credit cards cross 2.13 m by October; balances edge up to Rs. 166.9 b*

Sri Lanka‚Äôs active credit card base continued to grow through October 2025, reaching 2,133,417 cards, a 6.2% increase from December 2024, driven mainly by globally accepted cards. Locally accepted cards continued to decline, falling 7.9% over the same period. Outstanding credit card balances rose to Rs. 166.9 billion, up 5.7% year-to-date, with the majority of exposure on globally accepted cards.

https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Active-credit-cards-cross-2-13-m-by-October-balances-edge-up-to-Rs-166-9-b/44-786257

_*Global News*_

üéô *Asia-Pacific markets mostly fall on penultimate day of the year*
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/30/asia-markets-live-nikkei-kospi-hang-seng.html

-NESTOR RESEARCH-

the majority of exposure on globally accepted cards. _ global news _ asia pacific markets mostly fall on penultimate day of the year nestor research

*BRS News Flash 30.12.2025* 

‚Ä¢ Colombo Dockyard and banking shares pushed the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) All Share Price Index to close 0.29 percent higher from Friday while the S&P SL20 was marginally down, data on its site showed. üö¢üè¶üìà Source: https://economynext.com/sri-lanka-stocks-end-0-29-pct-higher-on-dockyard-banks-254956/

‚Ä¢ Sri Lanka‚Äôs apparel industry has delivered a robust performance during the first 11 months of 2025, with cumulative exports reaching $ 4,571.99 million, marking a 5.42% increase over the same period last year, according to data released yesterday by the Joint Apparel Association Forum (JAAF). üëï üåç üìä Source: https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Apparel-exports-up-5-42-in-first-11-months-despite-slight-dip-in-November/44-786264

‚Ä¢ Sri Lanka‚Äôs active credit card base continued to expand through October 2025, while outstanding balances also recorded a modest increase, according to the latest data released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL). üí≥ üìà üè™ Source: https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Active-credit-cards-cross-2-13-m-by-October-balances-edge-up-to-Rs-166-9-b/44-786257

‚Ä¢ Sri Lanka‚Äôs tourism sector reached a historic milestone yesterday as the country welcomed its 2,333,797th tourist for 2025, officially surpassing the previous all-time arrival record of 2,333,796 visitors set in 2018. ‚úàÔ∏èüèñÔ∏è üéâ Source: https://www.ft.lk/top-story/Sri-Lanka-tourism-sets-new-benchmark/26-786265

‚Ä¢ Sri Lanka‚Äôs yearly migration is to cross 300,000 individuals this year, despite the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) anticipating a decline below pre-crisis levels, SLBFE Chairperson Koshala Wickremasinghe told Derana on the Rebuild Sri Lanka show, aired on Saturday (27). üí∞ üì¶ üìà Source: https://www.themorning.lk/articles/3rDVeljhRT3H5VYe1QNN

‚Ä¢ Sri Lanka Customs, the national border agency, has seen a 65% increase in revenues so far with Rs. 2,497 billion posted by yesterday (29), Customs Media Spokesperson and Director of Customs Chandana Punchihewa said. üè® üõ†Ô∏è ‚è≥Source:https://www.themorning.lk/articles/20YXjsxULvQ0xhNX0t3j

‚Ä¢ Galadari Hotels has entered into an agreement with the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka to extend the project implementation period of its ongoing refurbishment by another 12 months to November 9, 2026. üéØüíµ üåè Source: https://economynext.com/sri-lankas-galadari-hotel-refurbishment-to-go-on-until-nov-2026-254901/

‚Ä¢ Sri Lanka‚Äôs tourism authorities have set an ambitious revenue target of US $ 4.5 billion for 2026, aiming to attract 2.7 million visitors by shifting focus toward high-spending demographics and untapped geographical markets to overcome the recent revenue stagnation. üéØ üíµ üåè Source: https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-main/Sri-Lanka-targets-US-4-5bn-revenue-2-7mn-arrivals-in-2026-with-pivot-to-high-spending-markets/245-328973

message_body:
That violent 10% candle wasn't retail selling. It was a forced liquidation event.

News confirmed: A major bank blew up its Silver Futures position at 2:00 AM from a missed margin call.

$34B Emergency Fed Injection + Forced Liquidation Algorithm triggered.

When a whale this big gets taken out, the market dumps everything to cover the hole. That‚Äôs why we saw the 10% wipeout.

üì∞ ASI ‚Äì Daily Market Movement | 26th December 2025

The market continued to trade within a narrow consolidation band, reflecting a cautious tone as the index attempts to stabilise above recent swing levels while remaining below the key short-term resistance clusters. Price action suggests controlled movement rather than directional conviction, keeping attention focused on whether a meaningful base is forming or whether the structure remains vulnerable to further weakness.

üìÖ Closed: 22,068.84
üîº High: 22,094.42
üîΩ Low: 21,959.05

‚∏ª

üìå Key Price Action ‚Äì Daily Time Frame

‚Ä¢ Higher High (12.11.2025): 23,769.46

‚Ä¢ Monthly HL: 14,570.34

Highest RSI ‚Äì DT: 96.65 | WT: 89.42 | MT: 84.63
Lowest RSI ‚Äì DT (07.04.2025): 26.17

‚∏ª

üïí Hourly Time Frame

‚Ä¢ MACD: Above signal, below zero
‚Ä¢ RSI: 52.61
‚Ä¢ Index Position: Above 9 & 20 | Below 50 & 200 SMA
‚Ä¢ 9 SMA: Above 20, below 50 & 200
‚Ä¢ 20 SMA: Below 50 & 200
‚Ä¢ 50 SMA: Below 200

Resistance: 22,131.67 ‚Ä¢ 22,395.54 ‚Ä¢ 22,692.27 ‚Ä¢ 23,013.91
Support: 21,913.53 ‚Ä¢ 21,712.62 ‚Ä¢ 21,434.46 ‚Ä¢ 21,140.68

‚∏ª

üìÖ Daily Time Frame

‚Ä¢ MACD: Below signal, below zero lines
‚Ä¢ RSI: 43.81
‚Ä¢ Index Position: Below 9, 20 & 50 | Above 100 & 200 SMA
‚Ä¢ 9 SMA: Below 20 & 50 | Above 100 & 200

Resistance: 22,394.29 ‚Ä¢ 23,024.29 ‚Ä¢ 23,668.11 ‚Ä¢ 24,121.03
Support: 21,747.58 ‚Ä¢ 21,187.92 ‚Ä¢ 20,625.04 ‚Ä¢ 20,233.78

‚∏ª

üïí Higher Time Frames

‚Ä¢ Weekly RSI: 59.85
‚Ä¢ Weekly MACD: Below signal, above zero
‚Ä¢ Monthly RSI: 78.01
‚Ä¢ Monthly MACD: Above signal & zero

‚∏ª

üí° Insight

The index continues to trade inside a consolidation pocket, holding above the recent swing low while remaining capped under the short-term resistance layers. The reclaim of the 9- and 20-SMA levels on the Hourly chart indicates improving short-term momentum, but the Daily setup remains corrective, with the index still below the 20- and 50-SMA cluster and the MACD below the signal line.

For a stronger bullish validation, the structure needs:

‚Ä¢ Sustained strength above 22,394.29 (Daily resistance)
‚Ä¢ A move back over the 20 & 50 SMA on the Daily chart
‚Ä¢ RSI pushing decisively above 50
‚Ä¢ MACD turning upward toward a signal-line cross

Until then, price action reflects a controlled consolidation rather than a confirmed reversal, and downside support levels must continue to hold to protect the existing swing structure.

*NESTOR STOCK BROKERS* 
 *MORNING NEWS BRIEF*
 *29th DECEMBER  2025* 

 *_Company ,Industry & Market News*_ 

üéô*Hemas Hospital Wattala partners SLSG 2025, leading Sri Lanka in advanced liver care*

Hemas Hospital Wattala reaffirmed its leadership in liver care by sponsoring the SLSG 2025 Annual Academic Sessions and showcasing Sri Lanka‚Äôs most advanced Fibroscan technology. The hospital demonstrated its commitment to medical innovation, early diagnosis, and personalised treatment through cutting-edge, non-invasive liver assessments.


https://www.ft.lk/healthcare/Hemas-Hospital-Wattala-partners-SLSG-2025-leading-Sri-Lanka-in-advanced-liver-care/45-786163

üéô *Sanasa Life suspension extended through January following IRCSL directive*

Sanasa Life Insurance has informed the CSE that the IRCSL has extended its suspension from conducting long-term insurance business until 30 January 2026 due to multiple regulatory breaches. The extension follows continued concerns over solvency, capital adequacy, and data integrity under the Regulation of Insurance Industry Act.

https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-news/Sanasa-Life-suspension-extended-through-January-following-IRCSL-directive/273-328866

 *_Economic and Government Updates*_ 

üéô *Indian outbound travel: SL among top destinations*

Sri Lanka has ranked as the third most-booked international destination among Indian travellers for the festive season, according to a MakeMyTrip report. The study, comparing bookings from 20 December to January 2026 with last year, highlighted rising interest in Sri Lanka as a preferred travel destination

https://www.themorning.lk/articles/trCAh39M6fYNzrQXIWSY

üéô *Gold prices gain over Rs. 10,000*

Local gold prices rose by over Rs. 10,000 last week, tracking a global rally driven by heightened geopolitical tensions between the US and Venezuela and strong safe-haven demand. As a result, 24-carat gold reached around Rs. 340,000 per sovereign locally, while global spot prices hit a record high above $4,440 per ounce.

https://www.themorning.lk/articles/a5nSsZwUtwQ7665XoXZV

üéô *Weak initiative threatens construction turnaround*

Despite increased capital expenditure in the 2026 Budget and large-scale reconstruction needs after Cyclone Ditwah, delays by public service officers could hinder a construction sector turnaround. The CCI noted that past underutilisation of capital allocations and excessive caution in tender processes continue to stall project execution

https://www.themorning.lk/articles/Z4ET61YoQ3MuiKngsxYF

üéô *Sri Lanka‚Äôs Weekly Economic Indicators Reflect Improving External Inflows and Fiscal Consolidation Province*

Headline inflation eased to 2.4% in November 2025, with both food and non-food inflation remaining low and core inflation showing only a mild uptick, indicating contained underlying demand pressures. Financial conditions stayed supportive as borrowing costs declined, with the AWPR falling to 8.94% and system liquidity remaining in surplus

cleaned_text: spreading for awareness

message_body:
Silver prices are shooting up due to severe global supply shortage.  

Here is what‚Äôs happening üëá by @BullTheoryio 

1. China is changing the rules.

Starting January 1, 2026, China will restrict silver exports.

To export silver, companies will now need government licenses.

Only large, state approved firms qualify:

- At least 80 tonnes of annual production
- Around $30 million in credit lines

This effectively blocks small and mid size exporters.

China controls roughly 60‚Äì70% of global silver supply. When China tightens exports, global supply drops immediately.

This is the same tactics China used with rare earth metals.

2. The silver market was already short supply.

Silver has been in a structural deficit for 5 straight years. That means demand is higher than supply every single year.

For 2025:

- Global demand: 1.24 billion ounces
- Global supply: 1.01 billion ounces

That is a gap of 100‚Äì250 million ounces. And this gap is expected to get worse after China‚Äôs export limits.

Mining supply is not growing:

Silver mining is mostly a by product of copper and zinc mining.

New mines take 10+ years to build, Ore quality is falling, Recycling is not enough to fill the gap.

There is no quick fix here.

3. Physical silver inventories are collapsing.

This is where it gets serious.

- COMEX inventories are down 70% since 2020
- London vaults are down 40%
- Shanghai inventories are at 10-year lows

At current demand, some regions hold only 30-45 days of usable silver.

This is why physical premiums are exploding.

In Shanghai:

- Physical silver trades at $80+/oz
- COMEX prices are much lower

This price gap means buyers are paying extra just to get real silver.

4. Paper silver is completely disconnected from reality.

There is an extreme imbalance between paper silver and real silver.

The paper to physical ratio is around 356:1.

That means:

- For every 1 ounce of real silver
- There are hundreds of paper claims

If even a small percentage of buyers ask for real delivery, the system breaks.

Markets understand this. That is why price moves are becoming vertical.

5. Industrial demand keeps rising.

Silver is not just a safe haven metal.

It is critical for:

- Solar panels
- Electric vehicles
- Electronics
- Medical devices

Industrial use now makes up 50-60% of total silver demand.

There is no substitute for silver in many of these uses.

Banks and institutions are reacting to:

- Supply limits
- Physical shortages
- Paper market risk

Silver is not rallying because of fear.

It is rallying because a real supply squeeze is playing out in real time.

message_body:
The Central Bank of Egypt (CBE) cut policy rates by another 100 bps yesterday, taking the overnight deposit and lending rates to 20.0% and 21.0%, respectively (Fig. 2). This was against our and market expectations of a pause, and marks the fifth rate cut in 2025, bringing cumulative easing to 725 bps. The December move was driven by a surprise slowdown in inflation alongside signs of moderating growth. The meeting‚Äôs tone was slightly dovish, with the MPC noting that demand-side pressures remain contained and acknowledging improving inflation expectations.

Notably, the decision came shortly after Egypt reached a staff-level agreement with the IMF under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) earlier this week. This agreement paves the way for a USD2.5 billion disbursement under the EFF and an additional USD1.3 billion from the RSF pending IMF Executive Board approval. The IMF commended the government‚Äôs fiscal discipline, though it stressed the need for state divestment and banking governance, and for raising the tax-to-GDP ratio from its current modest 12.2%.

We maintain our call of 600 bps in rate cuts in 2026, reducing the year-end lending rate to 15.0% ‚Äî slightly lower than our prior forecast of 16.0%. This should be supported by a reduction in inflation, from an average of c.14.0% in 2025 to an estimated c.11.0% in 2026
author: 19155621310603@lid

message_body:
LOLC SECURITIES NEWS ROUNDUP -26-Dec-25

*Financial services sec. expands by 13.2% in Q3*
Sri Lanka‚Äôs financial services activity, except insurance and pension funding and auxiliary financial services, expanded by 13.2% in the third quarter, due to an increase in loans and deposits, the Department of Census and Statistics‚Äô Gross Domestic Product by Production report for Q3 of 2025 said
Source: https://tinyurl.com/3bjh8mu2

*Combined share of provincial GDP increases in 2024*
While the Western province continued to hold the largest footprint in the country‚Äôs nominal GDP, the combined share of the other provinces increased in 2024, according to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka. The Western province continued to account for the largest share of the country‚Äôs nominal GDP, representing a share of 42.4% in 2024.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/3rjat4dv

*Exports earnings post $ 15.8 b*
Sri Lanka‚Äôs export sector has continued its upward trajectory, recording a 5.8 % year-on-year (y-o-y) growth during the period from January to November, according to the Export Development Board.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/p4jx22bj

*Inflation dips to 2.4% in Nov.*
The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the National Consumer Price Index (NCPI), has decreased to 2.4% in November, compared to 2.7% in October, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/59bdmv4j

*S&P Sri Lanka 20 Index: CSE announces constituent change*
The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) has announced changes in S&P Sri Lanka 20 index constituents made by S&P Dow Jones Indices at the 2025 Year End rebalance. Accordingly, Access Engineering PLC, People‚Äôs Leasing & Finance PLC, Singer Sri Lanka PLC and Sunshine Holdings PLC have been included in the list, while, Ceylon Cold Stores PLC, Chevron Lubricants Lanka PLC, Commercial Bank of Ceylon, LOLC Finance PLC and Royal Ceramics Lanka have been excluded.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/53z3pfc3

*BOI discusses Ditwah disruptions with industries*
The BOI is currently conducting a comprehensive evaluation of the support required by affected enterprises to recover from cyclone damage and to facilitate the early resumption of production and export activities. As an initial step, the BOI collected detailed data from impacted enterprises to determine the scope and nature of losses.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/229vax64

*December tourist surge gathers pace*
The tourism sector has gathered pace through December, welcoming 154,609 visitors in the first 21 days of the month and lifting year-to-date (YTD) arrivals to over 2.25 million (2,258,202). 
Source: https://tinyurl.com/bd55x3pk

*Govt. to rollout ‚ÄòSustainable Agriculture Program‚Äô with Rs. 800 m loan facility from 2026*
The Cabinet of Ministers at their meeting on Monday approved the launch of a new concessional agricultural loan scheme titled the ‚ÄúSustainable Agriculture Program‚Äù from next year, aimed at improving rural livelihoods and strengthening agriculture‚Äôs contribution to national economic growth.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/5c7eec4t 

*Global News*

*Core inflation in Japan's capital slows in December but stays above BOJ target*
Core consumer prices in Japan's capital rose 2.3% in December from a year earlier, data showed on Friday, staying above the central bank's 2% target and firming the case for further interest rate hikes.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/2p9rs9nr

*Ukraine, US negotiators discussed how to bring peace closer, Zelenskiy says*
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Thursday that he spoke with U.S. President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff and son-in-law Jared Kushner for about an hour on how to end the war with Russia.
Source: https://tinyurl.com/yxa5k22w

The index remains in a controlled consolidation phase, with price trading below short-term moving averages but still supported above key higher-low structures on broader time frames. The hourly trend remains weak, while the daily RSI continues to stabilise near the 40 region ‚Äî signalling cooling momentum rather than trend reversal.

For a constructive short-term shift, the index must defend its immediate support band while working toward reclaiming resistance levels and short-term moving averages. Until then, price action remains corrective rather than directional.

message_body:
*Softlogic Stockbrokers*
*News Alert ‚Äì 24th December 2025*


*Local*

*India pledges $ 450 m reconstruction package for Sri Lanka after Cyclone Ditwah*
‚Ä¢	Indian External Affairs Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar says pledge was formally conveyed to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake during meeting yesterday 
‚Ä¢	Notes package will comprise $ 350 m in concessional lines of credit and $ 100 m in grants
‚Ä¢	Assistance will focus on five key sectors worst affected by the cyclone
‚Ä¢	Reiterates India will continue to support Sri Lanka‚Äôs broader economic recovery
‚Ä¢	Assures continued encouragement of tourism traffic from India; says increased Indian FDIs could provide an additional boost at this critical juncture
‚Ä¢	Expresses confidence that Sri Lanka will once again demonstrate its resilience in recovering from adversity
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/India-pledges-450-m-reconstruction-package-for-Sri-Lanka-after-Cyclone-Ditwah/44-786040

*China offers support, expertise for ‚ÄúRebuilding Sri Lanka‚Äù program*
Communist Party of China visits Sri Lanka, meets President Dissanayake
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/China-offers-support-expertise-for-Rebuilding-Sri-Lanka-program/44-786038

*SriLankan Airlines launches post‚ÄìCyclone Ditwah destination recovery campaign*
SriLankan Airlines has launched a one-month international destination promotion campaign on 16 December 2025, aimed at restoring global confidence in Sri Lanka following Cyclone Ditwah and reaffirming the country‚Äôs readiness to welcome travellers.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/SriLankan-Airlines-launches-postCyclone-Ditwah-destination-recovery-campaign/44-786036

*Ditwah economic risk at $ 16 b, or 16% of GDP ‚Äì ILO*
‚Ä¢	ILO assessment finds Ditwah hits 374,000 workers; income losses at $ 48 m a month
‚Ä¢	Estimates that agriculture and fisheries sectors were severely hit 
‚Ä¢	Up to 23% of rice-cultivating land affected by floods, tea output losses as high as 35% 
‚Ä¢	Recommends emergency cash assistance and employment-intensive early recovery activities 
‚Ä¢	Recovery initiatives must combine with specific sectoral support and assistance to MSMEs 
https://www.ft.lk/top-story/Ditwah-economic-risk-at-16-b-or-16-of-GDP-ILO/26-786034

*Sahamitr Metal Pressure Containers gets contract to supply LPG cylinders for Litro Gas Lanka*
The Cabinet of Ministers on Monday approved awarding a major procurement contract for the LPG cylinders of various sizes for the period 2025‚Äì2027 to M/s. Sahamitr Metal Pressure Containers Public Co. Ltd.
https://www.ft.lk/business/Sahamitr-Metal-Pressure-Containers-gets-contract-to-supply-LPG-cylinders-for-Litro-Gas-Lanka/34-786054

*Govt. releases Rs. 106.2 m first-phase relief for Ditwah-hit industries*
The Government has commenced the first phase of relief assistance to industries affected by Cyclone Ditwah, with the Ministry of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development initiating a recovery program to restore industrial activity disrupted by the severe weather conditions and nationwide impact of the disaster.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Govt-releases-Rs-106-2-m-first-phase-relief-for-Ditwah-hit-industries/44-786042

*Access Engineering gets contract for 615-unit housing project in Kirulapone*
The Cabinet of Ministers on Monday approved the proposal presented by Transport, Highways and Urban Development Minister Anura Karunathilake on the recommendation of the Cabinet appointed standing procurement committee to award Access Engineering PLC the contract to build 615 housing units at Colombage Mawatha, Kirulapone, which had been stalled.
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/Access-Engineering-gets-contract-for-615-unit-housing-project-in-Kirulapone/44-786035

*13,000 containers remain congested across all terminals at Colombo port*
‚Ä¢	High level meeting on the congestion discuss temporary measures to ease situation
‚Ä¢	Industry highlights urgent need for decisive action rather than recurring discussions
https://www.ft.lk/front-page/13-000-containers-remain-congested-across-all-terminals-at-Colombo-port/44-786037

message_body:
*Treasury Yields Jump Across Tenors, Led by Sharp Rise in 1-Year Rate*

Treasury bill yields moved higher across all maturities this week, with the upward adjustment most pronounced at the longer end. The 3-month and 6-month yields increased by 4bps each to 7.55% and 7.95%, respectively, while the 1-year yield rose sharply by 16bps to 8.19%. The Central Bank offered LKR 150.00Bn and accepted LKR 82.45Bn, with the auction oversubscribed by 1.31 times.

message_body:
My personal opinion is that I will never teach my son about Commerce.
But my son already has an idea of our household income, what we can spend, and what he can ask for... He knows when to ask, what to ask, depending on my daily work schedule. 
I am really happy for a 7-year-old to have an idea, living among US kids, where needs are high.
As parents, it is our responsibility to teach them basic household finances rather than encourage them to gain theoretical knowledge.
Our own households are the best place to mold better future citizens.

message_body:
BREAKING NEWS: Gold Enters Historic "Super-Cycle" as Prices Shatter All-Time Records, Targeting $5,000+ by 2026

Colombo, Sri Lanka ‚Äì December 23, 2025 ‚Äì The global gold market is experiencing an unprecedented surge, with prices shattering all-time records and entering what economists are now calling a "Gold Super-Cycle." As of today, gold has cemented its position as the ultimate safe-haven asset, driven by a confluence of geopolitical instability, aggressive central bank buying, and mounting concerns over the future of fiat currencies.

A Historic Breakout: Gold Surges Past $4,400
As the global trading day concluded on December 22, 2025, gold prices hit an astounding $4,484.96 per ounce, marking an historic milestone. This unprecedented rally translates to a staggering 71% gain in 2025 alone, significantly outperforming major indices like the S&P 500 and even high-flying cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin. Analysts are noting this as gold's strongest annual performance since 1979, signaling a once-in-a-generation shift in global financial markets.

The "De-Dollarization" Imperative: Central Banks Lead the Charge
A primary catalyst for this "Super-Cycle" is the accelerating trend of "de-dollarization," where national governments are actively diversifying away from the U.S. Dollar. For the first time since 1996, gold has surpassed the share of US Treasuries in global central bank reserves.

"Central banks are leading this gold rush, viewing it as strategic insurance against currency volatility and geopolitical risks," states Dr. Aruna Wijesinghe, a senior economist based in Colombo. "Nations like China, India, Poland, and Brazil have been massive buyers through late 2025, collectively accumulating over 1,000 tonnes. This isn't just buying; it's a strategic repositioning."

Global Tensions Fuel Safe-Haven Demand
Escalating geopolitical instability continues to act as potent fuel for the gold rally. Recent developments paint a picture of increasing global uncertainty:

Mediterranean Crisis: Renewed attacks on oil tankers in the Mediterranean have sent shockwaves through global shipping and energy markets, prompting a flight to safety.

Venezuelan Blockade: A U.S.-led oil blockade against Venezuela has intensified economic pressures, driving institutional wealth into "hard assets" like gold and silver.

The "Trump Effect": Aggressive trade tariffs and threats to global supply chains have created an environment where investors increasingly rely on gold as a traditional hedge against economic and political turmoil.

2026 Forecasts: Major Banks Target $5,000+
The world's largest financial institutions are not merely observing; they are actively projecting gold's continued ascent. Leading investment banks have officially "raised the bar" for their price targets:

J.P. Morgan: Forecasts an average price of $5,055 per ounce by Q4 2026.

Bank of America: Has set an ambitious target of $5,000 per ounce, citing persistent concerns over the rising U.S. national deficit.

Goldman Sachs: Projects gold to reach $4,900 per ounce by December 2026.

The "Super Bull" Case: Some analysts even suggest a "stress case" scenario could see gold touching $6,000 per ounce in the longer term, especially if global debt concerns intensify.

Implications for Sri Lankan Investors
For Sri Lankan investors and consumers, this global trend has immediate and significant repercussions. While the local price of a 24KT sovereign hitting approximately LKR 350,000 might seem high, it is merely a reflection of this global "migration" of wealth.

"The era of 'cheap gold' is officially over," advises Mr. Sanjaya Perera, a local bullion expert. "Gold is no longer just jewelry; it has unequivocally returned to its role as the world's ultimate currency and a critical component of strategic wealth preservation. Investors should consider gold's long-term trajectory rather than short-term fluctuations."

The message to Sri Lankan gold owners is clear: "Don't sell in haste. This is still the early phase of an extraordinary rally." For those looking to invest, strategic buying during any market "dips" is advised, as current prices may appear significantly undervalued by 2026.

Key Market Snapshot (December 23, 2025):

Current Global Price: ~$4,485 /oz (All-time high)

Annual Return (YTD): +71% (Best since 1979)

2026 Price Prediction: $5,000+ per ounce

Silver Status: Also at record highs (~$69 /oz)

Main Buyer: Global Central Banks (accumulating over 1,000+ Tonnes annually)

message_body:
ASI ‚Äì Daily Market Movement

22nd December 2025

The Colombo Stock Exchange closed lower on Monday as selling pressure persisted amid weak intraday momentum and subdued participation. The ASI continued to trade below key short-term moving averages, reflecting ongoing corrective behaviour following the November peak.

Market Snapshot

Close: 21,898.20
High: 22,194.48
Low: 21,890.29
Turnover: Rs. 2.98Bn
Volume: 81.90Mn
No. of Trades: 26,497

Key Price Action ‚Äì Daily Time Frame

Higher High: 23,769.46 (12.11.2025)
Daily Higher Low: 21,431.28 (05.12.2025)
Weekly Higher Low: 20,352.71
Monthly Higher Low: 14,570.34
20 DMA: 22,279.40
Intraday ATH: 23,769.46 (12.11.2025)
Closing ATH: 23,659.70 (12.11.2025)
All-Time Swing High: 23,769.46

RSI Extremes

Highest RSI:

Daily: 96.65 (02.01.2025)
Weekly: 89.42 (12.11.2025)
Monthly: 84.63 (12.11.2025)

Lowest RSI:

Daily: 26.17 (07.04.2025)

Hourly Time Frame

MACD: Below signal and zero lines
RSI: 18.52
Index Position: Below 9, 20, 50, and 200 SMA lines

SMA Structure:

9 SMA below 20, 50, and 200
20 SMA below 50 and 200
50 SMA below 200

Hourly Resistance:
21,913.53 | 22,131.67 | 22,395.54 | 22,692.27
Hourly Support:
21,712.62 | 21,434.46 | 21,140.68 | 20,869.35

Daily Time Frame

MACD: Below the signal, and zero lines
RSI: 38.85
Index Position: Below 9, 20, and 50; above 100 and 200 SMA lines

SMA Structure:

9 SMA below 20 and 50, above 100 and 200

Daily Resistance:
22,394.29 | 23,024.29 | 23,668.11 | 24,121.03
Daily Support:
21,747.58 | 21,187.92 | 20,625.04 | 20,233.78

Higher Time Frames

Weekly RSI: 58.05
Weekly MACD: Below the signal and above zero lines
Monthly RSI: 76.84
Monthly MACD: Above the signal and zero lines

Insight

The ASI remains under corrective pressure with momentum firmly negative on the hourly chart, where RSI has slipped into deeply oversold territory. Despite this, the index continues to hold above its Daily Higher Low at 21,431.28, keeping the broader trend structure technically intact for now.

On the daily chart, price remains below short-term moving averages while still holding above the 100- and 200-day SMAs, indicating that the market is undergoing a correction within a larger uptrend rather than a confirmed trend reversal. The compression between weakening momentum and higher-time-frame support levels suggests heightened sensitivity around the 21,700‚Äì21,400 zone.

Sustained weakness below the current support band would increase downside risk toward the lower daily support levels. Conversely, any recovery attempt will first need to reclaim the 22,394 zone to stabilise near-term price action.

message_body:
*Softlogic Stockbrokers*
*News Alert ‚Äì 23rd December 2025*

*Local*

*Damage from Cyclone Ditwah in Sri Lanka estimated at US $4.1 Billion*
The Cyclone Ditwah, which struck Sri Lanka in late November, has caused an estimated US$4.1 billion in direct physical damage to buildings and contents, agriculture and critical infrastructure, according to a World Bank Group Global Rapid Post-Disaster Damage Estimation (GRADE) report released today. This damage is equivalent to about 4 percent of Sri Lanka‚Äôs GDP. The cyclone, among the most intense and destructive in Sri Lanka‚Äôs recent history, severely affected close to 2 million people and 500,000 families across all 25 districts, disrupting livelihoods, essential services, and the broader economy.
https://www.dailymirror.lk/breaking-news/Damage-from-Cyclone-Ditwah-in-Sri-Lanka-estimated-at-US-4-1-Billion/108-328564 

*Exports rise 5.6% in November*
Sri Lanka‚Äôs exports rose 5.56 percent year-on-year (YoY) in November 2025 to US $ 1.36 billion, supported by a steady growth in both merchandise shipments and services earnings, as the exporters sustained momentum amid the fragile global trade conditions, the official data showed. Total exports in November, including merchandise and services, reached an estimated US $ 1.36 billion, reflecting what the authorities described as the effectiveness of the efforts to expand market access and strengthen competitiveness.
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-main/Exports-rise-5-6-in-November/245-328601 

*November national prices soften on food and non-food price cooling*
The consumer prices measured nationally showed the prices have risen by 2.4 percent in the 12 months through November 2025, somewhat softening from 2.7 percent through October, as both food prices and non-food prices cooled a bit. This is the last inflation print before the effects of this month‚Äôs floods wreaked havoc causing damage to agriculture and industries.
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-news/November-national-prices-soften-on-food-and-non-food-price-cooling/273-328600 

*Western province share of GDP at 42.4% in CY24 but rest share rose*
The Western province added the most to the country‚Äôs total output, with a share of 42.4 percent in 2024 but its share came down from 44.0 percent in 2023, while the combined share of the other provinces rose, in a reflection that they are gradually adding more to the total economy. For instance, the North Western province, which had a share of 11.5 percent, became the second after the Western province and grew from the 10.9 percent share it had in 2023.
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-news/Western-province-share-of-GDP-at-42-4-in-CY24-but-rest-share-rose/273-328598 

*Vidullanka emerges lowest bidder for mini hydropower project in Fiji*
Vidullanka PLC announced it has emerged as the lowest-cost bidder for an engineering, procurement and construction contract to expand and upgrade a 100-kilowatt mini hydropower facility at Buca Village in Fiji, marking a potential overseas renewable energy win for the Sri Lankan firm. In a disclosure to the Colombo Stock Exchange, the company said the determination was made on December 19, 2025 and represents a material step towards securing the contract, although the formal award is still pending.
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-news/Vidullanka-emerges-lowest-bidder-for-mini-hydropower-project-in-Fiji/273-328597 

*DFCC Bank gets green light for Standard Chartered retail, wealth banking acquisition*
DFCC Bank has secured the regulatory clearance to move ahead with its proposed acquisition of the wealth and retail banking business of Standard Chartered Bank‚Äôs Sri Lanka branch, the lender said in a stock exchange filing yesterday. The Central Bank of Sri Lanka has granted approval under Section 12(1)(c) of Banking Act No. 30 of 1988, clearing a key hurdle for the transaction first announced in November 2025.
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-news/DFCC-Bank-gets-green-light-for-Standard-Chartered-retail-wealth-banking-acquisition/273-328595

*SriLankan launches operations at Terminal 1 of Velana Int‚Äôl Airport*
SriLankan Airlines officially transitioned its operations to Terminal 1 at Velana International Airport, Mal√©, effective 17 December 2025. To commemorate the move, Maldives Airports Company Ltd (MACL) hosted a ceremonial welcome for passengers arriving on UL101 at Terminal 1, as well as those departing from Terminal 1 on UL102.  The event was attended by Mohamed Rizvi Hassen, Sri Lanka High Commissioner to the Maldives, as Chief Guest, alongside senior officials from MACL and SriLankan Airlines. Operating three daily flights to Male via its Colombo hub, SriLankan Airlines connects passengers to a global network of 117 destinations across 59 countries. 
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-news/SriLankan-launches-operations-at-Terminal-1-of-Velana-Intl-Airport/273-328590 

*HNB partners with Gaia Green Energy to introduce affordable solar financing solutions*
HNB PLC has signed a strategic MoU with Gaia Green Energy Holdings Pvt Ltd, a provider of solar energy systems, to promote sustainable energy adoption through affordable personal and SME loan facilities. This partnership enables eligible customers of Gaia Green Energy Holdings to access special financing options from HNB to purchase solar electricity generation equipment.  The initiative is designed to support Sri Lanka‚Äôs transition to renewable energy while easing the financial burden for households and small businesses. 
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-news/HNB-partners-with-Gaia-Green-Energy-to-introduce-affordable-solar-financing-solutions/273-328589 

*Sampath Bank partners with Toyota Lanka to make vehicle ownership more rewarding*
Sampath Bank PLC announced the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Toyota Lanka (Private) Limited recently at the Toyota Lanka Head Office, marking a strategic collaboration aimed at providing enhanced financial and value-added benefits to customers purchasing Toyota vehicles across Sri Lanka.
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-news/Sampath-Bank-partners-with-Toyota-Lanka-to-make-vehicle-ownership-more-rewarding/273-328588 

*Cargills Food City mobilises island wide flood relief effort to support affected communities*
In response to the recent floods that impacted communities across Sri Lanka, Cargills Food City swiftly launched an islandwide relief initiative to support those affected and stand by the nation during this critical time of need. As part of its immediate relief efforts, Cargills Food City distributed 10,000 ration packs to flood-affected families across all impacted areas, ensuring timely access to essential food items when they were needed most. 
https://www.dailymirror.lk/business-news/Cargills-Food-City-mobilises-island-wide-flood-relief-effort-to-support-affected-communities/273-328584 


*Global*

*Spot gold hits record high*
Spot gold hit a record high in early Asia hours trade on Tuesday, propelled by rate cut bets, geopolitical and economic uncertainty, and central bank and ETF buying. The yellow metal hit a record high of $4,445.69 per ounce.
https://www.reuters.com/world/india/spot-gold-hits-record-high-2025-12-22/ 

*Wall Street advances with broad gains, tech gains continue*
U.S. stocks closed higher to kick off the holiday-shortened trading week on Monday, buoyed partly by a continued rebound by technology stocks in a broad advance that saw gains among almost all of the 11 S&P 500 sectors. The bounce in tech names began late last week and was driven by Micron Technology's (MU.O), opens new tab blowout forecasts and a cooler-than-expected inflation report, which has left the S&P 500 and Dow less than 1% from their record closing levels set on December 11.

message_body:
Equity Market Outlook 2026 ‚Äì Summary

1. Cyclone Ditwa Impact

A slow-moving cyclone between Nov 26‚Äì29 caused severe flooding across Badulla, Vavuniya, and the eastern/central regions. Colombo avoided severe direct rainfall but experienced river-driven flooding.

2. Rainfall & Infrastructure Stress

Some regions received over 200 mm of rain on consecutive days. Reservoirs overflowed due to extreme inflows, resulting in widespread structural damage, road failures, and community displacement.

3. Human & Housing Losses

Approximately 635 deaths, 191 missing, 6,200 homes destroyed, and nearly 95,000 damaged, out of about 5‚Äì5.2 million total households.

4. Tourism Resilience

Despite weather-related publicity, tourism indicators remain strong. Arrivals and spending trends show a promising season ahead.

5. Electricity & Energy Conditions

High hydro generation has kept electricity costs stable. However, tariff distortions remain: industrial tariffs are extremely low (~Rs. 14), while commercial tariffs are disproportionately high.

6. Fiscal Stabilisation

Sri Lanka posted a primary surplus in 2023 ‚Äî a rare achievement historically. This supports macroeconomic stability, investor confidence, and future policy strength.


---

Sector Outlook ‚Äì Based on Explicit Webinar Insights

1. Construction & Infrastructure

The largest reconstruction demand in years ‚Äî rebuilding homes, roads, bridges, reservoirs, and utilities. Expected to be a major economic driver in 2026.

2. Power & Utilities

Electricity grid repairs, reservoir rehabilitation, and continued reliance on hydro make this a key sector for operational and investment activity.

3. Tourism

Momentum remains strong. Positive arrival numbers and good seasonal forecasts position tourism as a leading recovery sector.

4. Manufacturing (Energy-Intensive)

Very low industrial electricity tariffs give manufacturers a significant cost advantage, supporting competitiveness and margins.

5. Consumer & Retail

Consumption expected to gradually recover with stabilising inflation, better energy cost conditions, and tourism-driven demand.

6. Banking & Financial Services

Improved fiscal discipline and macro stability support credit growth, healthier balance sheets, and reduced systemic risk.


---

Overall 2026 Market Narrative

Reconstruction momentum, stabilised energy conditions, tourism strength, and a historic primary surplus create a supportive backdrop for the equity market entering 2026.

message_body:
Summary 

1Ô∏è‚É£ Big Picture Summary ‚Äì Equity Market Outlook 2026
The presentation by Murtaza Jafferjee (JB Securities / JB Financial) frames 2026 as a transition year, not a euphoric bull market.

Core message:
Returns will be selective, valuation-driven, and highly dependent on macro stability and weather-related risks.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Key Risks Highlighted
üåßÔ∏è Climate & Weather Risk (Very Important)
Cyclone Ditwa was used as a case study, not a one-off event.

Key insight:

It was slow-moving, causing prolonged rainfall

Damage was worse because the ground was already saturated from the NE monsoon

Badulla, central-eastern and hill-country regions were disproportionately affected.

Investment implication:

Earnings volatility in:

Plantations üå±

Hydro-dependent utilities ‚ö°

Infrastructure & logistics üöö

This is not priced properly in many plantation counters.

üìâ Macro & Market Risks
Global rates likely plateau, not sharply fall

Sri Lanka growth = fragile but improving

Market risk:

Index may look ‚Äúcheap‚Äù

Earnings risk is underappreciated

3Ô∏è‚É£ Catalysts for 2026
‚úÖ Domestic
Gradual economic normalization

Improved FX stability

Recovery in tourism volumes

Better credit growth (not explosive)

‚úÖ Market-specific
Stock picking > index investing

Re-rating opportunities in:

Banks

Exporters

Select tourism plays

4Ô∏è‚É£ Valuations ‚Äì The Hidden Message
Although not fully visible yet in your transcript, the structure strongly suggests:

Headline P/E looks cheap

But:

Earnings quality matters

Weather-adjusted and cycle-adjusted earnings matter more

üëâ Expect valuation dispersion:

Good companies get re-rated

Weak balance sheets stay cheap (value traps)

5Ô∏è‚É£ Stocks & Sectors to Watch for 2026 (Practical List)
üè¶ BANKS ‚Äì Core Holdings (Lower Risk)
Why: Stable ROEs, improving asset quality, benefit from normalization.

Watch:

COMB.N ‚Äì Best balance sheet quality

HNB.N ‚Äì Corporate & SME exposure

DFCC.N ‚Äì Recovery + valuation upside

‚õî Avoid over-leveraged finance companies

üè® TOURISM ‚Äì Earnings Momentum Plays
Why: Volumes recovering, pricing power improving.

Watch:

AHUN.N ‚Äì Diversified hotel + logistics exposure

SHOT.N ‚Äì Higher operational leverage

REKA.N ‚Äì Pure tourism recovery story (higher risk)

‚ö†Ô∏è Weather risk exists but urban / resort diversification helps

üå± PLANTATIONS ‚Äì Selective, Not Broad
Key takeaway from cyclone discussion:

Weather risk is structural, not temporary.

Only look at:

Companies with:

Geographic diversification

Strong balance sheets

Rubber + palm exposure

Selective ideas:

WATA.N ‚Äì Diversified, better management

BOPL.N ‚Äì If valuation corrects further

‚ö†Ô∏è Be cautious with:

Pure up-country tea-heavy estates

üì° TELECOM / INFRA ‚Äì Defensive Growth
(Not directly discussed yet, but macro-aligned)

Watch:

SLTL.N ‚Äì Data growth, infrastructure play

DIAL.N ‚Äì Recovery + potential asset monetization

Good fit for low-volatility portfolios

üè≠ EXPORTERS ‚Äì Under-the-Radar Opportunities
Why: FX stability + global demand pockets

Watch:

HAYL.N ‚Äì Diversified export exposure

TJIL.N ‚Äì Apparel recovery (timing matters)

6Ô∏è‚É£ How to Position for 2026 (Strategy)
‚úîÔ∏è Focus on earnings resilience, not just low P/E
‚úîÔ∏è Prefer banks + tourism + selective defensives
‚úîÔ∏è Treat plantations as tactical trades, not long-term holds
‚úîÔ∏è Keep cash for weather / macro-driven corrections

message_body: The World Bank Group's GRADE report on Cyclone DIWA provides a comprehensive assessment of the damage caused by the cyclone, which is estimated at *US$4.1 billion* . This figure represents approximately 4% of Sri Lanka's GDP and highlights the significant impact on the nation's physical assets. The report is crucial for guiding emergency response, recovery planning, and long-term disaster risk reduction efforts. It utilizes the World Bank's rapid, remote, model-based GRADE methodology to estimate direct economic damage to physical assets, although it does not account for income or production losses, nor the full costs of recovery and reconstruction. The Central Province was the hardest hit, with Kandy district experiencing damages estimated at $689 million, primarily due to flooding and landslides. Infrastructure, including roads, bridges, railways, and water supply networks, accounted for the largest share of damage at $1.735 billion (42%), disrupting connectivity and access to markets and services. Residential buildings and contents suffered $985 million in damage, and agriculture sustained $814 million in damages, affecting crops, livestock, and infrastructure. The report underscores the urgent need for resilient construction designs and flood control measures to withstand high winds and flooding
